   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %% There are some environment variables that can be used to "manipulate"
   22: %% the test suite: 
   23: %%
   24: %% Variable that controls which 'groups' are to run (with default values)
   25: %%
   26: %%         ESOCK_TEST_REG:         include
   27: %%         ESOCK_TEST_MON:         include
   28: %%         ESOCK_TEST_IOCTL:       include
   29: %%         ESOCK_TEST_SOCK_CLOSE:  include
   30: %%         ESOCK_TEST_TICKETS:     include
   31: %%
   32: %% Variable that controls "verbosity" of the test case(s):
   33: %%
   34: %%         ESOCK_TEST_QUIET: true (default) | false
   35: %%
   36: 
   37: %% Run the entire test suite: 
   38: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, [batch]).
   39: %%
   40: %% Run a specific group:
   41: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, {group, foo}, [batch]).
   42: %%
   43: %% Run a specific test case:
   44: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, foo, [batch]).
   45: %%
   46: %% (cd /mnt/c/$LOCAL_TESTS/26/kernel_test/ && $ERL_TOP/bin/win32/erl.exe -sname kernel-26-tester -pa c:$LOCAL_TESTS/26/test_server)
   47: %% application:set_env(kernel, test_inet_backends, true).
   48: %% S = fun() -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, [batch]) end.
   49: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, [batch]) end.
   50: %% S = fun() -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}]) end.
   51: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}]) end.
   52: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   53: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   54: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   55: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   56: %% T = fun(TC) -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, TC, [batch]) end.
   57: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   58: %% T = fun(S, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   59: %% T = fun(S, G, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {group, G}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   60: %%
   61: %% Some official info about AF_UNIX
   62: %% https://devblogs.microsoft.com/commandline/windowswsl-interop-with-af_unix/
   63: 
   64: 
   65: 
   66: -module(socket_SUITE).
   67: 
   68: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   69: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct_event.hrl").
   70: -include("socket_test_evaluator.hrl").
   71: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   72: 
   73: %% Suite exports
   74: -export([suite/0, all/0, groups/0]).
   75: -export([init_per_suite/1,    end_per_suite/1,
   76:          init_per_group/2,    end_per_group/2,
   77:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   78:

  182: 
  183: suite() ->
  184:     [{ct_hooks, [ts_install_cth]},
  185:      {timetrap, {minutes,1}}].
  186: 
  187: all() -> 
  188:     Groups = [{reg,          "ESOCK_TEST_REG",        include},
  189:               {monitor,      "ESOCK_TEST_MON",        include},
  190:               {ioctl,        "ESOCK_TEST_IOCTL",      include},
  191: 	      {socket_close, "ESOCK_TEST_SOCK_CLOSE", include},
  192: 	      {tickets,      "ESOCK_TEST_TICKETS",    include}],
  193:     [use_group(Group, Env, Default) || {Group, Env, Default} <- Groups].
  194: 
  195: use_group(_Group, undefined, exclude) ->
  196:     [];
  197: use_group(Group, undefined, _Default) ->
  198:     [{group, Group}];
  199: use_group(Group, Env, Default) ->
  200: 	case os:getenv(Env) of
  201: 	    false when (Default =:= include) ->
  202: 		[{group, Group}];
  203: 	    false ->
  204: 		[];
  205: 	    Val ->
  206: 		case list_to_atom(string:to_lower(Val)) of
  207: 		    Use when (Use =:= include) orelse 
  208: 			     (Use =:= enable) orelse 
  209: 			     (Use =:= true) ->
  210: 			[{group, Group}];
  211: 		    _ ->
  212: 			[]
  213: 		end
  214: 	end.
  215:     
  216: 
  217: groups() -> 
  218:     [{reg,                         [], reg_simple_cases()},
  219: 
  220:      {monitor,                     [], monitor_cases()},
  221: 
  222:      {socket_close,                [], socket_close_cases()},
  223:      {sc_ctrl_proc_exit,           [], sc_cp_exit_cases()},
  224:      {sc_local_close,              [], sc_lc_cases()},
  225:      {sc_remote_close,             [], sc_rc_cases()},
  226:      {sc_remote_shutdown,          [], sc_rs_cases()},
  227: 
  228:      {ioctl,                       [], ioctl_cases()},
  229:      {ioctl_simple,                [], ioctl_simple_cases()},
  230:      {ioctl_get,                   [], ioctl_get_cases()},
  231:      {ioctl_set,                   [], ioctl_set_cases()},
  232: 
  233:      %% Ticket groups
  234:      {tickets,                     [], tickets_cases()},
  235:      {otp16359,                    [], otp16359_cases()},
  236:      {otp18240,                    [], otp18240_cases()}
  237:     ].
  238:

  398: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  399:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  400:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  401:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  402:     
  403:     try socket:info() of
  404:         #{} ->
  405:             case ?KLIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
  406:                 {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  407:                     SKIP;
  408: 
  409:                 Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  410: 
  411:                     ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  412:                        "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  413: 
  414:                     %% We need a monitor on this node also
  415:                     kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  416: 
  417:                     socket:use_registry(false),
  418:                     case quiet_mode(Config1) of
  419:                         default ->
  420:                             case ?LOGGER:start() of
  421:                                 ok ->
  422:                                     Config1;
  423:                                 {error, Reason} ->
  424:                                     ?P("init_per_suite -> "
  425:                                        "Failed starting logger"
  426:                                        "~n   Reason: ~p"
  427:                                        "~n", [Reason]),
  428:                                     {skip, "Failed starting logger"}
  429:                             end;
  430:                         Quiet ->
  431:                             case ?LOGGER:start(Quiet) of
  432:                                 ok ->
  433:                                     [{esock_test_quiet, Quiet} | Config1];
  434:                                 {error, Reason} ->
  435:                                     ?P("init_per_suite -> "
  436:                                        "Failed starting logger"
  437:                                        "~n   Reason: ~p"
  438:                                        "~n", [Reason]),
  439:                                     {skip, "Failed starting logger"}
  440:                             end
  441:                     end
  442:             end
  443:     catch
  444:         error : notsup ->
  445:             {skip, "esock not supported"};
  446:         error : undef ->
  447:             {skip, "esock not configured"}
  448:     end.
  449: 
  450: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  451: 
  452:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  453:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  454:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  455: 
  456:     %% Stop the local monitor
  457:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  458: 
  459:     (catch ?LOGGER:stop()),
  460: 
  461:     Config1 = ?KLIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  462: 
  463:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  464:        "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  465: 
  466:     Config1.
  467: 
  468: 
  469: init_per_group(GroupName, Config)
  470:   when (GroupName =:= sc_remote_close) orelse
  471:        (GroupName =:= sc_remote_shutdown) ->
  472:     io:format("init_per_group(~w) -> entry with"
  473:               "~n   Config: ~p"
  474:               "~n", [GroupName, Config]),
  475:     %% Maybe we should skip the entire suite for this platform,
  476:     %% but for now we just skip these groups, which seem to 
  477:     %% have problems (node start).
  478:     %% As stated elsewhere, its not really Fedora 16, but 
  479:     %% the *really* slow VM that is the issue.
  480:     try is_old_fedora16() of
  481:         ok ->
  482:             Config
  483:     catch
  484:         throw:{skip, _} = SKIP ->
  485:             SKIP
  486:     end;
  487: init_per_group(GroupName, Config)
  488:   when (GroupName =:= ioctl) ->
  489:     io:format("init_per_group(~w) -> entry with"
  490:               "~n   Config:"
  491:               "~n      ~p"
  492:               "~nwhen"
  493:               "~n   Supported IOCtl Requests: "
  494:               "~n~s"
  495:               "~n   Supported IOCtl Flags: "
  496:               "~n~s"
  497:               "~n", [GroupName, Config,
  498:                      format_ioctls(socket:supports(ioctl_requests), 6),
  499:                      format_ioctls(socket:supports(ioctl_flags), 6)]),
  500:     Config;
  501: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  502:     Config.
  503: 
  504: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  505:     Config.
  506: 
  507: format_ioctls(Reqs, PrefixSz) ->
  508:     Max = format_ioctls_max(Reqs),
  509:     format_ioctls(Reqs, string:pad("", PrefixSz), Max).
  510: 
  511: format_ioctls_max(Reqs) ->
  512:     format_ioctls_max(Reqs, 0).
  513: 
  514: format_ioctls_max([], Max) ->
  515:     Max;
  516: format_ioctls_max([{Req, _}|Reqs], Max) when is_atom(Req) ->
  517:     ReqStr = atom_to_list(Req),
  518:     case length(ReqStr)+1 of
  519:         NewMax when (NewMax > Max) ->
  520:             format_ioctls_max(Reqs, NewMax);
  521:         _ ->
  522:             format_ioctls_max(Reqs, Max)
  523:     end.
  524: 
  525: format_ioctls(IOCtls, Prefix, Max) ->
  526:     format_ioctls(IOCtls, Prefix, Max, []).
  527: 
  528: format_ioctls([], _Prefix, _Max, Acc) ->
  529:     lists:flatten(lists:reverse(Acc));
  530: format_ioctls([{Key, Sup}|IOCtls], Prefix, Max, Acc) ->
  531:     format_ioctls(IOCtls, Prefix, Max,
  532:                   [format_ioctl(Key, Sup, Prefix, Max) | Acc]).
  533: 
  534: format_ioctl(Key, Sup, Prefix, Max) ->
  535:     KeyStr  = io_lib:format("~w:", [Key]),
  536:     KeyStr2 = lists:flatten(string:pad(KeyStr, Max, trailing, " ")),
  537:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~s~s ~w~n", [Prefix, KeyStr2, Sup])).
  538: 
  539: 
  540: init_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  541:     io:format("init_per_testcase(~w) -> entry with"
  542:               "~n   Config: ~p"
  543:               "~n", [_TC, Config]),
  544:     Config.
  545: 
  546: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  547:     Config.
  548: 
  549: 
  550: quiet_mode(Config) ->
  551:     case lists:keysearch(esock_test_quiet, 1, Config) of
  552:         {value, {esock_test_quiet, Quiet}} ->
  553:             Quiet;
  554:         false ->
  555:             case os:getenv("ESOCK_TEST_QUIET") of
  556:                 "true"  -> true;
  557:                 "false" -> false;
  558:                 _       -> default
  559:             end
  560:     end.
  561:

  568: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  569: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  570: 
  571: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  572: %% We create a bunch of different sockets and ensure that the registry
  573: %% has the correct info.
  574: 
  575: reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  576:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
  577:     tc_try(reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count,
  578:            fun() ->
  579:                    ok = reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count()
  580:            end).
  581: 
  582: 
  583: reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count() ->
  584:     socket:use_registry(true),
  585: 
  586:     {OS, _} = os:type(),
  587: 
  588:     %% We may have some sockets already existing.
  589:     %% Make sure we dont count them when we test.
  590:     Existing = socket:which_sockets(),
  591:     N = length(Existing),
  592:     SupportsIPV6 =
  593:         case (catch has_support_ipv6()) of
  594:             ok ->
  595:                 true;
  596:             _ ->
  597:                 false
  598:         end,
  599:     SupportsLOCAL =
  600:         case (catch has_support_unix_domain_socket()) of
  601:             ok ->
  602:                 true;
  603:             _ ->
  604:                 false
  605:         end,
  606:     SupportsSCTP =
  607:         case (catch has_support_sctp()) of
  608:             ok ->
  609:                 true;
  610:             _ ->
  611:                 false
  612:         end,
  613:     InitSockInfos =
  614:         [
  615:          {inet, stream, tcp},
  616:          {inet, dgram,  udp}
  617:         ] ++
  618:         case SupportsIPV6 of
  619:             true ->
  620:                 [
  621:                  {inet6, stream, tcp},
  622:                  {inet6, dgram,  udp}
  623:                 ];
  624:             false ->
  625:                 []
  626:         end ++
  627:         case SupportsLOCAL of
  628:             true when (OS =/= win32) ->
  629:                 [
  630:                  {local, stream, default},
  631:                  {local, dgram,  default}
  632:                 ];
  633:             true ->
  634:                 [
  635:                  {local, stream, default}
  636:                 ];
  637:             false ->
  638:                 []
  639:         end ++
  640:         [
  641:          {inet, stream, tcp},
  642:          {inet, dgram,  udp}
  643:         ] ++
  644:         case SupportsSCTP of
  645:             true ->
  646:                 %% On some platforms this is not enough,
  647:                 %% we need to actually check this "by doing it"...
  648:                 ?P("test open sctp socket"),
  649:                 case socket:open(inet,
  650:                                  seqpacket,
  651:                                  sctp,
  652:                                  #{use_registry => false}) of
  653:                     {ok, S} ->
  654:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: success"),
  655:                         (catch socket:close(S)),
  656:                         [
  657:                          {inet, seqpacket, sctp},
  658:                          {inet, seqpacket, sctp}
  659:                         ];
  660:                     {error, _} ->
  661:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: failed"),
  662:                         []
  663:                 end;
  664:             false ->
  665:                 []
  666:         end ++
  667:         [
  668:          {inet, stream, tcp},
  669:          {inet, dgram,  udp}
  670:         ] ++
  671:         case SupportsSCTP andalso SupportsIPV6 of
  672:             true ->
  673:                 %% On some platforms this is not enough,
  674:                 %% we need to actually check this "by doing it"...
  675:                 ?P("test open sctp socket"),
  676:                 case socket:open(inet6,
  677:                                  seqpacket,
  678:                                  sctp,
  679:                                  #{use_registry => false}) of
  680:                     {ok, S6} ->
  681:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: success"),
  682:                         (catch socket:close(S6)),
  683:                         [
  684:                          {inet6, seqpacket, sctp},
  685:                          {inet6, seqpacket, sctp}
  686:                         ];
  687:                     {error, _} ->
  688:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: failed"),
  689:                         []
  690:                 end;
  691:             false ->
  692:                 []
  693:         end,
  694: 
  695:     i("open sockets"),
  696:     Socks =
  697:         [fun({Domain, Type, Proto}) ->
  698:                  i("open socket: ~w, ~w, ~w", [Domain, Type, Proto]),
  699:                  {ok, Sock} = socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto),
  700:                  Sock
  701:          end(InitSockInfo) || InitSockInfo <- InitSockInfos],
  702: 
  703:     ?SLEEP(1000),
  704: 
  705: 
  706:     %% **** Total Number Of Sockets ****
  707: 
  708:     NumSocks1 = N + length(Socks),
  709:     NumberOf1 = socket:number_of(),
  710: 
  711:     i("verify (total) number of sockets(1): ~w, ~w",
  712:       [NumSocks1, NumberOf1]),
  713:     case (NumSocks1 =:= NumberOf1) of
  714:         true ->
  715:             ok;
  716:         false ->
  717:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_sockets1, {NumSocks1, NumberOf1})
  718:     end,
  719: 
  720: 
  721:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 TCP Sockets ****
  722: 
  723:     %% inet, stream, tcp
  724:     SiNumTCP = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet, stream, tcp),
  725:     SrNumTCP = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet, stream, tcp),
  726: 
  727:     i("verify number of IPv4 TCP sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumTCP, SrNumTCP]),
  728:     case (SiNumTCP =:= SrNumTCP) of
  729:         true ->
  730:             ok;
  731:         false ->
  732:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_ipv4_tcp_sockets, {SiNumTCP, SrNumTCP})
  733:     end,
  734: 
  735: 
  736:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 UDP Sockets ****
  737: 
  738:     %% inet, dgram, udp
  739:     SiNumUDP = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet, dgram, udp),
  740:     SrNumUDP = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet, dgram, udp),
  741: 
  742:     i("verify number of IPv4 UDP sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumUDP, SrNumUDP]),
  743:     case (SiNumUDP =:= SrNumUDP) of
  744:         true ->
  745:             ok;
  746:         false ->
  747:             exit({wrong_number_of_ipv4_udp_sockets, SiNumUDP, SrNumUDP})
  748:     end,
  749: 
  750: 
  751:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 SCTP Sockets ****
  752: 
  753:     %% inet, seqpacket, sctp
  754:     SiNumSCTP = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet, seqpacket, sctp),
  755:     SrNumSCTP = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet, seqpacket, sctp),
  756: 
  757:     i("verify number of IPv4 SCTP sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumSCTP, SrNumSCTP]),
  758:     case (SiNumSCTP =:= SrNumSCTP) of
  759:         true ->
  760:             ok;
  761:         false ->
  762:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_sctp_sockets, {SiNumSCTP, SrNumSCTP})
  763:     end,
  764: 
  765: 
  766:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 Sockets ****
  767: 
  768:     %% inet
  769:     SiNumINET = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet),
  770:     SrNumINET = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet),
  771: 
  772:     i("verify number of IPv4 sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumINET, SrNumINET]),
  773:     case (SiNumINET =:= SrNumINET) of
  774:         true ->
  775:             ok;
  776:         false ->
  777:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_ipv4_sockets, {SiNumINET, SrNumINET})
  778:     end,
  779: 
  780: 
  781:     %% **** Number Of IPv6 Sockets ****
  782: 
  783:     %% inet6
  784:     SiNumINET6 = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet6),
  785:     SrNumINET6 = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet6),
  786: 
  787:     i("verify number of IPv6 sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumINET6, SrNumINET6]),
  788:     case (SiNumINET6 =:= SrNumINET6) of
  789:         true ->
  790:             ok;
  791:         false ->
  792:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_ipv6_sockets, {SiNumINET6, SrNumINET6})
  793:     end,
  794: 
  795: 
  796:     %% **** Number Of Unix Domain Sockets Sockets ****
  797: 
  798:     %% local
  799:     SiNumLOCAL = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, local),
  800:     SrNumLOCAL = reg_sr_num(Existing, local),
  801: 
  802:     i("verify number of Unix Domain Sockets sockets: ~w, ~w",
  803:       [SiNumLOCAL, SrNumLOCAL]),
  804:     case (SiNumLOCAL =:= SrNumLOCAL) of
  805:         true ->
  806:             ok;
  807:         false ->
  808:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_local_sockets, {SiNumLOCAL, SrNumLOCAL})
  809:     end,
  810: 
  811: 
  812:     %% **** Close *all* Sockets then verify Number Of Sockets ****
  813: 
  814:     i("close sockets"),
  815:     lists:foreach(fun(S) ->
  816:                           i("close socket"),                          
  817:                           ok = socket:close(S)
  818:                   end, Socks),
  819: 
  820:     ?SLEEP(1000),
  821: 
  822:     NumberOf2 = socket:number_of(),
  823: 
  824:     i("verify number of sockets(2): ~w, ~w", [N, NumberOf2]),
  825:     case (N =:= NumberOf2) of
  826:         true ->
  827:             ok;
  828:         false ->
  829:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_sockets2, {N, NumberOf2})
  830:     end,
  831: 
  832: 
  833:     i("verify owner sockets (none)", []),
  834:     Expected1 = [],
  835:     case socket:which_sockets(self()) of
  836:         Expected1 ->
  837:             ok;
  838:         Unexpected1 ->
  839:             reg_si_fail(wrong_sockets_own1, {Expected1, Unexpected1})
  840:     end,
  841: 
  842:     i("create some sockets", []),
  843:     OwnSockets = lists:sort(
  844:                    [fun({D, T})->
  845:                             i("create ~w:~w socket", [D, T]),
  846:                             {ok, OSocks} = socket:open(D, T, default),
  847:                             OSocks
  848:                     end(SockInfo) || SockInfo <-
  849:                                          [{inet, dgram},
  850:                                           {inet, dgram},
  851:                                           {inet, stream},
  852:                                           {inet, stream}]]),
  853: 
  854:     i("verify owner sockets (~w)", [length(OwnSockets)]),
  855:     case lists:sort(socket:which_sockets(self())) of
  856:         OwnSockets ->
  857:             ok;
  858:         Unexpected2 ->
  859:             reg_si_fail(wrong_sockets_own2, {OwnSockets, Unexpected2})
  860:     end,
  861: 
  862:     i("close (own) sockets"),
  863:     lists:foreach(fun(S) ->
  864:                           i("close socket"),                          
  865:                           ok = socket:close(S)
  866:                   end, OwnSockets),
  867:     ?SLEEP(1000),
  868: 
  869:     i("verify number of sockets(2) (again)"),
  870:     NumberOf2 = socket:number_of(),
  871: 
  872:     i("verify pre-existing sockets(2)", []),
  873:     case socket:which_sockets() of
  874:         Existing ->
  875:             ok;
  876:         OtherSockets ->
  877:             reg_si_fail(wrong_sockets2, {Existing, OtherSockets})
  878:     end,
  879: 
  880:     socket:use_registry(false),
  881:     ok.
  882: 
  883: 
  884: reg_si_fail(Reason, Extra) ->
  885:     socket:use_registry(false),
  886:     exit({Reason, Extra}).
  887: 
  888: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain)
  889:   when ((Domain =:= inet) orelse (Domain =:= inet6) orelse (Domain =:= local)) ->
  890:     reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain, undefined, undefined);
  891: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Type)
  892:   when ((Type =:= stream) orelse (Type =:= dgram) orelse (Type =:= seqpacket)) ->
  893:     reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, Type, undefined);
  894: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Proto)
  895:   when ((Proto =:= sctp) orelse (Proto =:= tcp) orelse (Proto =:= udp)) ->
  896:     reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, undefined, Proto).
  897: 
  898: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain, undefined, undefined) ->
  899:     F = fun({D, _T, _P}) when (D =:= Domain) -> true;
  900:            (_) -> false
  901:         end,
  902:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo);
  903: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, Type, undefined) ->
  904:     F = fun({_D, T, _P}) when (T =:= Type) -> true;
  905:            (_) -> false
  906:         end,
  907:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo);
  908: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, undefined, Proto) ->
  909:     F = fun({_D, _T, P}) when (P =:= Proto) -> true;
  910:            (_) -> false
  911:         end,
  912:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo);
  913: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain, Type, Proto) ->
  914:     F = fun({D, T, P}) when (D =:= Domain) andalso
  915:                             (T =:= Type) andalso
  916:                             (P =:= Proto) ->
  917:                 true;
  918:            (_) ->
  919:                 false
  920:         end,
  921:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo).
  922: 
  923: reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo) ->
  924:     length(lists:filter(F, SocksInfo)).
  925: 
  926: 
  927: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain)
  928:   when ((Domain =:= inet) orelse (Domain =:= inet6)) ->
  929:     length(socket:which_sockets(Domain) -- Existing);
  930: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain)
  931:   when (Domain =:= local) ->
  932:     reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain, undefined, undefined);
  933: reg_sr_num(Existing, Type)
  934:   when ((Type =:= stream) orelse (Type =:= dgram) orelse (Type =:= seqpacket)) ->
  935:     length(socket:which_sockets(Type) -- Existing);
  936: reg_sr_num(Existing, Proto)
  937:   when ((Proto =:= sctp) orelse (Proto =:= tcp) orelse (Proto =:= udp)) ->
  938:     length(socket:which_sockets(Proto) -- Existing).
  939: 
  940: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain, undefined, undefined) ->
  941:     F = fun(#{domain := D}) when (D =:= Domain) ->
  942:                 true;
  943:            (_X) ->
  944:                 false
  945:         end,
  946:     reg_sr_num2(Existing, F);
  947: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain, Type, Proto) ->
  948:     F = fun(#{domain   := D,
  949:               type     := T,
  950:               protocol := P}) when (D =:= Domain) andalso
  951:                                    (T =:= Type) andalso
  952:                                    (P =:= Proto) ->
  953:                 true;
  954:            (_X) ->
  955:                 %% i("reg_sr_num -> not counting: "
  956:                 %%   "~n   ~p", [_X]),
  957:                 false
  958:         end,
  959:     reg_sr_num2(Existing, F).
  960: 
  961: reg_sr_num2(Existing, F) ->
  962:     length(socket:which_sockets(F) -- Existing).
  963: 
  964: 
  965: 
  966: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  967: %% We create a bunch of different sockets and ensure that the registry
  968: %% has the correct info.
  969: 
  970: reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  971:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
  972:     tc_try(reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count,
  973:            fun() ->
  974:                    ok = reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count()
  975:            end).
  976: 
  977: 
  978: reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count() ->
  979:     i("Make sure use of socket registry is enabled (regardless of default)"),
  980:     socket:use_registry(true),
  981:     #{use_registry := true} = socket:info(),
  982: 
  983:     i("get current socket base count"),
  984:     Base = socket:number_of(),
  985: 
  986:     i("create a socket and ensure its counted"),
  987:     {ok, S1} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp),
  988:     Base1 = Base + 1,
  989:     case socket:number_of() of
  990:         Base1 ->
  991:             ok;
  992:         Invalid1 -> 
  993:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets1, Invalid1, Base + 1})
  994:     end,
  995:     i("close the socket and ensure its counted (back to base)"),
  996:     ok = socket:close(S1),
  997:     case socket:number_of() of
  998:         Base ->
  999:             ok;
 1000:         Invalid2 -> 
 1001:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets2, Invalid2, Base})
 1002:     end,
 1003: 
 1004:     i("create a socket with use_registry explicitly off "
 1005:       "and ensure its not counted"),
 1006:     {ok, S2} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp, #{use_registry => false}),
 1007:     case socket:number_of() of
 1008:         Base ->
 1009:             ok;
 1010:         Invalid3 -> 
 1011:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets3, Invalid3, Base})
 1012:     end,
 1013:     i("close the socket and ensure its not counted"),
 1014:     ok = socket:close(S2),
 1015:     case socket:number_of() of
 1016:         Base ->
 1017:             ok;
 1018:         Invalid4 -> 
 1019:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets4, Invalid4, Base})
 1020:     end,
 1021: 
 1022:     i("Globally disable use of registry"),
 1023:     socket:use_registry(false),
 1024:     #{use_registry := false} = socket:info(),
 1025:     i("create a socket and ensure its not counted"),
 1026:     {ok, S3} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp),
 1027:     case socket:number_of() of
 1028:         Base ->
 1029:             ok;
 1030:         Invalid5 -> 
 1031:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets5, Invalid5, Base})
 1032:     end,
 1033:     i("close the socket and ensure its not counted"),
 1034:     ok = socket:close(S3),
 1035:     case socket:number_of() of
 1036:         Base ->
 1037:             ok;
 1038:         Invalid6 -> 
 1039:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets6, Invalid6, Base})
 1040:     end,
 1041: 
 1042:     i("create a socket with use_registry explicitly on "
 1043:       "and ensure its counted"),
 1044:     {ok, S4} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp, #{use_registry => true}),
 1045:     case socket:number_of() of
 1046:         Base1 ->
 1047:             ok;
 1048:         Invalid7 -> 
 1049:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets7, Invalid7, Base + 1})
 1050:     end,
 1051:     i("close the socket and ensure counted (back to base)"),
 1052:     ok = socket:close(S4),
 1053:     case socket:number_of() of
 1054:         Base ->
 1055:             ok;
 1056:         Invalid8 -> 
 1057:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets8, Invalid8, Base})
 1058:     end,
 1059: 
 1060:     socket:use_registry(false),
 1061:     i("done"),
 1062:     ok.
 1063: 
 1064: 
 1065: 
 1066: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1067: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1068: %%                                                                     %%
 1069: %%                       SOCKET MONITOR                                %%
 1070: %%                                                                     %%
 1071: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1072: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1073: 
 1074: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1075: %% Create one socket, monitor from a different process then close socket.
 1076: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 1077: 
 1078: monitor_simple_open_and_close(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1079:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1080:     tc_try(monitor_simple_open_and_close,
 1081:            fun() ->
 1082: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1083:                                  type     => stream,
 1084:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1085:                    ok = mon_simple_open_and_close(InitState)
 1086:            end).
 1087: 
 1088: 
 1089: mon_simple_open_and_close(InitState) ->
 1090:     OwnerSeq =
 1091:         [
 1092:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1093:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1094:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1095:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1096:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1097:                    end},
 1098:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1099:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1100:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1101:                            ok
 1102:                    end},
 1103: 
 1104:          %% *** Init part ***
 1105:          #{desc => "create socket",
 1106:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1107:                          type     := Type, 
 1108:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1109:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1110:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1111:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 1112:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1113:                                    ERROR
 1114:                            end
 1115:                    end},
 1116:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 1117:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1118:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 1119:                            ok
 1120:                    end},
 1121: 
 1122:          %% The actual test
 1123:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 1124:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 1125:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 1126:                    end},
 1127: 
 1128:          #{desc => "close socket",
 1129:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1130:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 1131: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 1132:                    end},
 1133: 
 1134:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 1135:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 1136:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 1137:                                ok ->
 1138:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 1139:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1140:                                    ERROR
 1141:                            end
 1142:                    end},
 1143: 
 1144:          %% *** We are done ***
 1145:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1146:         ],
 1147: 
 1148:     TesterSeq =
 1149:         [
 1150:          %% *** Init part ***
 1151:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 1152:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 1153:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 1154:                            ok
 1155:                    end},
 1156:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 1157:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1158:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 1159:                            ok
 1160:                    end},
 1161:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 1162:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 1163:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 1164:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 1165:                    end},
 1166:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1167:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1168: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1169: 			   ok
 1170:                    end},
 1171:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1172:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1173: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1174: 			   ok
 1175:                    end},
 1176:          #{desc => "monitor socket - create two",
 1177:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1178:                            MRef1 = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1179:                            MRef2 = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1180: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor(s): "
 1181: 				       "~n   1: ~p"
 1182: 				       "~n   2: ~p", [MRef1, MRef2]),
 1183: 			   {ok, State#{mon1 => MRef1, mon2 => MRef2}}
 1184:                    end},
 1185:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=2)",
 1186:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1187: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1188: 			   ok
 1189:                    end},
 1190:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=2)",
 1191:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1192: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1193: 			   ok
 1194:                    end},
 1195:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - (self) two",
 1196:            cmd  => fun(#{mon1 := MRef1,
 1197: 			 mon2 := MRef2} = _State) ->
 1198: 			   Mons = lists:sort([MRef1, MRef2]),
 1199: 			   case lists:sort(socket:which_monitors(self())) of
 1200: 			       Mons ->
 1201: 				   ok;
 1202: 			       SMons ->
 1203: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected (self) monitors: "
 1204: 					       "~n   Expected: ~p"
 1205: 					       "~n   Actual:   ~p",
 1206: 					       [Mons, SMons]),
 1207: 				   {error, unexpected_monitors}
 1208: 			   end
 1209:                    end},
 1210:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - (sock) two",
 1211:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1212: 			 mon1 := MRef1,
 1213: 			 mon2 := MRef2} = _State) ->
 1214: 			   Mons = lists:sort([MRef1, MRef2]),
 1215: 			   case lists:sort(socket:which_monitors(Sock)) of
 1216: 			       Mons ->
 1217: 				   ok;
 1218: 			       SMons ->
 1219: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected (sock) monitors: "
 1220: 					       "~n   Expected: ~p"
 1221: 					       "~n   Actual:   ~p",
 1222: 					       [Mons, SMons]),
 1223: 				   {error, unexpected_monitors}
 1224: 			   end
 1225:                    end},
 1226:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - only us",
 1227:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1228: 			   Self   = self(),
 1229: 			   [Self] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1230: 			   ok
 1231:                    end},
 1232: 
 1233:          %% The actual test
 1234:          #{desc => "order owner to close",
 1235:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1236:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 1237:                            ok
 1238:                    end},
 1239:          #{desc => "await socket down 1",
 1240:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1241: 			 mon1 := MRef} = State) ->
 1242: 			   receive
 1243: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1244: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 1245: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1246: 					       "~n      Socket: ~s"
 1247: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1248: 					       [MRef,
 1249: 						socket:to_list(Sock),
 1250: 						Info]),
 1251: 				   {ok, maps:remove(mon1, State)}
 1252: 			   after 5000 ->
 1253: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 1254: 				   {error, timeout}
 1255: 			   end
 1256:                    end},
 1257:          #{desc => "await socket down 2",
 1258:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1259: 			 mon2  := MRef} = State) ->
 1260: 			   receive
 1261: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1262: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 1263: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1264: 					       "~n      Socket: ~s"
 1265: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1266: 					       [MRef,
 1267: 						socket:to_list(Sock),
 1268: 						Info]),
 1269: 				   {ok, maps:remove(mon2, State)}
 1270: 			   after 5000 ->
 1271: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 1272: 				   {error, timeout}
 1273: 			   end
 1274:                    end},
 1275:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1276:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1277: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1278: 			   ok
 1279:                    end},
 1280:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1281:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1282: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1283: 			   ok
 1284:                    end},
 1285:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - only one",
 1286:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1287: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(self()),
 1288: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(Sock),
 1289: 			   ok
 1290:                    end},
 1291:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - none",
 1292:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1293: 			   [] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1294: 			   ok
 1295:                    end},
 1296: 
 1297:          %% Cleanup
 1298:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 1299:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1300:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 1301:                            ok
 1302:                    end},
 1303: 
 1304:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 1305:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1306:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 1307:                                ok ->
 1308:                                    ok;
 1309:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1310:                                    ERROR
 1311:                            end
 1312:                    end},
 1313: 
 1314:          %% *** We are done ***
 1315:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1316:         ],
 1317: 
 1318:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 1319:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 1320: 
 1321:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 1322:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 1323:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 1324: 
 1325:     i("await evaluator"),
 1326:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 1327: 
 1328: 
 1329: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1330: %% Create one socket, monitor from a different process then stop the
 1331: %% owner process.
 1332: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 1333: 
 1334: monitor_simple_open_and_exit(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1335:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1336:     tc_try(monitor_simple_open_and_exit,
 1337:            fun() ->
 1338: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1339:                                  type     => stream,
 1340:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1341:                    ok = mon_simple_open_and_exit(InitState)
 1342:            end).
 1343: 
 1344: 
 1345: mon_simple_open_and_exit(InitState) ->
 1346:     OwnerSeq =
 1347:         [
 1348:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1349:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1350:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1351:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1352:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1353:                    end},
 1354:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1355:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1356:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1357:                            ok
 1358:                    end},
 1359: 
 1360:          %% *** Init part ***
 1361:          #{desc => "create socket",
 1362:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1363:                          type     := Type, 
 1364:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1365:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1366:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1367:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 1368:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1369:                                    ERROR
 1370:                            end
 1371:                    end},
 1372:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 1373:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1374:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 1375:                            ok
 1376:                    end},
 1377: 
 1378:          %% The actual test
 1379:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 1380:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 1381:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 1382:                                ok ->
 1383:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 1384:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1385:                                    ERROR
 1386:                            end
 1387:                    end},
 1388: 
 1389:          %% *** We are done ***
 1390:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1391:         ],
 1392: 
 1393:     TesterSeq =
 1394:         [
 1395:          %% *** Init part ***
 1396:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 1397:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 1398:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 1399:                            ok
 1400:                    end},
 1401:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 1402:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1403:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 1404:                            ok
 1405:                    end},
 1406:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 1407:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 1408:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 1409:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 1410:                    end},
 1411:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1412:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1413: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1414: 			   ok
 1415:                    end},
 1416:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1417:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1418: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1419: 			   ok
 1420:                    end},
 1421:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 1422:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1423:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1424: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor: ~p", [MRef]),
 1425: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
 1426:                    end},
 1427:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=1)",
 1428:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1429: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1430: 			   ok
 1431:                    end},
 1432:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
 1433:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1434: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1435: 			   ok
 1436:                    end},
 1437:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - only one",
 1438:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1439: 			 mon  := MRef} = _State) ->
 1440: 			   [MRef] = socket:which_monitors(self()),
 1441: 			   [MRef] = socket:which_monitors(Sock),
 1442: 			   ok
 1443:                    end},
 1444:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - only us",
 1445:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1446: 			   Self   = self(),
 1447: 			   [Self] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1448: 			   ok
 1449:                    end},
 1450: 
 1451:          %% The actual test
 1452:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 1453:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1454:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 1455:                            ok
 1456:                    end},
 1457:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 1458:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1459:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 1460:                                ok ->
 1461:                                    ok;
 1462:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1463:                                    ERROR
 1464:                            end
 1465:                    end},
 1466: 
 1467:          #{desc => "await socket down",
 1468:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1469: 			 mon  := MRef} = _State) ->
 1470: 			   receive
 1471: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1472: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 1473: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1474: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 1475: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1476: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 1477: 				   ok
 1478: 			   after 5000 ->
 1479: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 1480: 				   {error, timeout}
 1481: 			   end
 1482:                    end},
 1483:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1484:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1485: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1486: 			   ok
 1487:                    end},
 1488:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1489:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1490: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1491: 			   ok
 1492:                    end},
 1493:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - only one",
 1494:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1495: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(self()),
 1496: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(Sock),
 1497: 			   ok
 1498:                    end},
 1499:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - none",
 1500:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1501: 			   [] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1502: 			   ok
 1503:                    end},
 1504: 
 1505:          %% *** We are done ***
 1506:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1507:         ],
 1508: 
 1509:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 1510:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 1511: 
 1512:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 1513:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 1514:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 1515: 
 1516:     i("await evaluator"),
 1517:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 1518:

 1520: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1521: %% Create one socket, monitor from a different process, cancel_montor
 1522: %% (demonitor) and then close socket.
 1523: %% The process that did the monitor shall *not* receive a socket DOWN.
 1524: 
 1525: monitor_simple_open_and_demon_and_close(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1526:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1527:     tc_try(monitor_simple_open_and_demon_and_close,
 1528:            fun() ->
 1529: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1530:                                  type     => stream,
 1531:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1532:                    ok = mon_simple_open_and_demon_and_close(InitState)
 1533:            end).
 1534: 
 1535: 
 1536: mon_simple_open_and_demon_and_close(InitState) ->
 1537:     OwnerSeq =
 1538:         [
 1539:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1540:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1541:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1542:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1543:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1544:                    end},
 1545:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1546:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1547:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1548:                            ok
 1549:                    end},
 1550: 
 1551:          %% *** Init part ***
 1552:          #{desc => "create socket",
 1553:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1554:                          type     := Type, 
 1555:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1556:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1557:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1558:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 1559:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1560:                                    ERROR
 1561:                            end
 1562:                    end},
 1563:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 1564:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1565:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 1566:                            ok
 1567:                    end},
 1568: 
 1569:          %% The actual test
 1570:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 1571:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 1572:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 1573:                    end},
 1574: 
 1575:          #{desc => "close socket",
 1576:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1577:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 1578: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 1579:                    end},
 1580: 
 1581:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 1582:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 1583:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 1584:                                ok ->
 1585:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 1586:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1587:                                    ERROR
 1588:                            end
 1589:                    end},
 1590: 
 1591:          %% *** We are done ***
 1592:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1593:         ],
 1594: 
 1595:     TesterSeq =
 1596:         [
 1597:          %% *** Init part ***
 1598:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 1599:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 1600:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 1601:                            ok
 1602:                    end},
 1603:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 1604:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1605:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 1606:                            ok
 1607:                    end},
 1608:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 1609:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 1610:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 1611:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 1612:                    end},
 1613:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1614:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1615: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1616: 			   ok
 1617:                    end},
 1618:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1619:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1620: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1621: 			   ok
 1622:                    end},
 1623:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 1624:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1625:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1626: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor: ~p", [MRef]),
 1627: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
 1628:                    end},
 1629:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=1)",
 1630:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1631: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1632: 			   ok
 1633:                    end},
 1634:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
 1635:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1636: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1637: 			   ok
 1638:                    end},
 1639: 
 1640:          %% The actual test
 1641:          #{desc => "demonitor socket",
 1642:            cmd  => fun(#{mon := MRef} = State) ->
 1643:                            true = socket:cancel_monitor(MRef),
 1644: 			   {ok, maps:remove(mon, State)}
 1645:                    end},
 1646: 
 1647: 	 #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1648: 	   cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1649: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1650: 			   ok
 1651: 		   end},
 1652: 	 #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1653: 	   cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1654: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1655: 			   ok
 1656: 		   end},
 1657: 
 1658:          #{desc => "order owner to close",
 1659:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1660:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 1661:                            ok
 1662:                    end},
 1663: 
 1664:          #{desc => "await socket down",
 1665:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1666: 			   receive
 1667: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1668: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("received UNEXPECTED down: "
 1669: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1670: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 1671: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1672: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 1673: 				   {error, unexpected_down}
 1674: 			   after 5000 ->
 1675: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("expected socket down timeout"),
 1676: 				   ok
 1677: 			   end
 1678:                    end},
 1679: 
 1680:          %% Cleanup
 1681:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 1682:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1683:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 1684:                            ok
 1685:                    end},
 1686: 
 1687:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 1688:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1689:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 1690:                                ok ->
 1691:                                    ok;
 1692:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1693:                                    ERROR
 1694:                            end
 1695:                    end},
 1696: 
 1697:          %% *** We are done ***
 1698:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1699:         ],
 1700: 
 1701:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 1702:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 1703: 
 1704:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 1705:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 1706:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 1707: 
 1708:     i("await evaluator"),
 1709:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 1710:

 1712: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1713: %% Create several sockets, monitor from a different process then close
 1714: %% socket. The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 1715: 
 1716: monitor_open_and_close_multi_socks(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1717:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1718:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_close_multi_socks,
 1719:            fun() ->
 1720: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1721:                                  type     => stream,
 1722:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1723:                    ok = mon_open_and_close_multi_socks(InitState)
 1724:            end).
 1725: 
 1726: 
 1727: mon_open_and_close_multi_socks(InitState) ->
 1728:     OwnerSeq =
 1729:         [
 1730:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1731:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1732:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1733:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1734:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1735:                    end},
 1736:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1737:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1738:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1739:                            ok
 1740:                    end},
 1741:

 2152: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2153: %% Create several sockets, monitor from a different process then exit
 2154: %% the owner process.
 2155: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 2156: 
 2157: monitor_open_and_exit_multi_socks(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 2158:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 2159:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_exit_multi_socks,
 2160:            fun() ->
 2161: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 2162:                                  type     => stream,
 2163:                                  protocol => tcp},
 2164:                    ok = mon_open_and_exit_multi_socks(InitState)
 2165:            end).
 2166: 
 2167: 
 2168: mon_open_and_exit_multi_socks(InitState) ->
 2169:     OwnerSeq =
 2170:         [
 2171:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 2172:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 2173:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 2174:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 2175:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 2176:                    end},
 2177:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 2178:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2179:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 2180:                            ok
 2181:                    end},
 2182: 
 2183:          %% *** Init part ***
 2184:          #{desc => "create socket 1",
 2185:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2186:                          type     := Type, 
 2187:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2188:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2189:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2190:                                    {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock}};
 2191:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2192:                                    ERROR
 2193:                            end
 2194:                    end},
 2195:          #{desc => "create socket 2",
 2196:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2197:                          type     := Type, 
 2198:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2199:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2200:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2201:                                    {ok, State#{sock2 => Sock}};
 2202:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2203:                                    ERROR
 2204:                            end
 2205:                    end},
 2206:          #{desc => "create socket 3",
 2207:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2208:                          type     := Type, 
 2209:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2210:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2211:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2212:                                    {ok, State#{sock3 => Sock}};
 2213:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2214:                                    ERROR
 2215:                            end
 2216:                    end},
 2217:          #{desc => "create socket 4",
 2218:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2219:                          type     := Type, 
 2220:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2221:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2222:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2223:                                    {ok, State#{sock4 => Sock}};
 2224:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2225:                                    ERROR
 2226:                            end
 2227:                    end},
 2228:          #{desc => "create socket 5",

 2230:                          type     := Type, 
 2231:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2232:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2233:                                {ok, Sock} ->

 2235:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2236:                                    ERROR
 2237:                            end
 2238:                    end},
 2239:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 2240:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 2241: 			 sock1  := Sock1,
 2242: 			 sock2  := Sock2,
 2243: 			 sock3  := Sock3,
 2244: 			 sock4  := Sock4,
 2245: 			 sock5  := Sock5} = _State) ->
 2246: 			   Socks = [Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5],
 2247:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Socks),
 2248:                            ok
 2249:                    end},
 2250: 
 2251: 
 2252:          %% The actual test
 2253:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 2254:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 2255:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 2256:                                ok ->
 2257:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 2258:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2259:                                    ERROR
 2260:                            end
 2261:                    end},
 2262: 
 2263:          %% *** We are done ***
 2264:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 2265:         ],
 2266:

 2268:         [

 2309:                            MRef4 = socket:monitor(Sock4),
 2310:                            MRef5 = socket:monitor(Sock5),
 2311: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitors:"
 2312: 				       "~n   1: ~p"
 2313: 				       "~n   2: ~p"
 2314: 				       "~n   3: ~p"
 2315: 				       "~n   4: ~p"
 2316: 				       "~n   5: ~p",
 2317: 				       [MRef1, MRef2, MRef3, MRef4, MRef5]),
 2318: 			   {ok, State#{mon1 => MRef1,
 2319: 				       mon2 => MRef2,
 2320: 				       mon3 => MRef3,
 2321: 				       mon4 => MRef4,
 2322: 				       mon5 => MRef5}}
 2323:                    end},
 2324:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=5)",
 2325:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2326: 			   5 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2327: 			   ok
 2328:                    end},
 2329:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=5)",
 2330:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2331: 			   5 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2332: 			   ok
 2333:                    end},
 2334: 
 2335:          %% The actual test
 2336:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 2337:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2338:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 2339:                            ok
 2340:                    end},
 2341: 
 2342:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 2343:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2344:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 2345:                                ok ->
 2346:                                    ok;
 2347:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2348:                                    ERROR
 2349:                            end
 2350:                    end},
 2351: 
 2352:          #{desc => "await socket 1 down",
 2353:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock,
 2354: 			 mon1  := MRef} = State) ->
 2355: 			   receive
 2356: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2357: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2358: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2359: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2360: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2361: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2362: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock1, State),
 2363: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon1,  State2),
 2364: 				   {ok, State3}
 2365: 			   after 5000 ->
 2366: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2367: 				   {error, timeout}
 2368: 			   end
 2369:                    end},
 2370:          #{desc => "await socket 2 down",
 2371:            cmd  => fun(#{sock2 := Sock,
 2372: 			 mon2  := MRef} = State) ->
 2373: 			   receive
 2374: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2375: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2376: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2377: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2378: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2379: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2380: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock2, State),
 2381: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon2,  State2),
 2382: 				   {ok, State3}
 2383: 			   after 5000 ->
 2384: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2385: 				   {error, timeout}
 2386: 			   end
 2387:                    end},
 2388:          #{desc => "await socket 3 down",
 2389:            cmd  => fun(#{sock3 := Sock,
 2390: 			 mon3  := MRef} = State) ->
 2391: 			   receive
 2392: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2393: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2394: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2395: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2396: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2397: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2398: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock3, State),
 2399: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon3,  State2),
 2400: 				   {ok, State3}
 2401: 			   after 5000 ->
 2402: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2403: 				   {error, timeout}
 2404: 			   end
 2405:                    end},
 2406:          #{desc => "await socket 4 down",
 2407:            cmd  => fun(#{sock4 := Sock,
 2408: 			 mon4  := MRef} = State) ->
 2409: 			   receive
 2410: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2411: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2412: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"

 2415: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),

 2418: 				   {ok, State3}

 2457:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 2458:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 2459:

 2465:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).

 2468: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2469: %% Create several sockets, monitor from a different process, demonitor
 2470: %% two of them then close socket.
 2471: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN for
 2472: %% the sockets that are still monitored.
 2473: 
 2474: monitor_open_and_demon_and_close_multi_socks(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 2475:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 2476:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_demon_and_close_multi_socks,
 2477:            fun() ->
 2478: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 2479:                                  type     => stream,
 2480:                                  protocol => tcp},
 2481:                    ok = mon_open_and_demon_and_close_multi_socks(InitState)
 2482:            end).
 2483: 
 2484: 
 2485: mon_open_and_demon_and_close_multi_socks(InitState) ->
 2486:     OwnerSeq =
 2487:         [
 2488:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 2489:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 2490:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 2491:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 2492:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 2493:                    end},
 2494:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 2495:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2496:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 2497:                            ok
 2498:                    end},
 2499: 
 2500:          %% *** Init part ***
 2501:          #{desc => "create socket 1",
 2502:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2503:                          type     := Type, 
 2504:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2505:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2506:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2507:                                    {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock}};
 2508:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2509:                                    ERROR
 2510:                            end
 2511:                    end},
 2512:          #{desc => "create socket 2",
 2513:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2514:                          type     := Type, 
 2515:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2516:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2517:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2518:                                    {ok, State#{sock2 => Sock}};
 2519:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2520:                                    ERROR
 2521:                            end
 2522:                    end},
 2523:          #{desc => "create socket 3",
 2524:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2525:                          type     := Type, 
 2526:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2527:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2528:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2529:                                    {ok, State#{sock3 => Sock}};
 2530:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2531:                                    ERROR
 2532:                            end
 2533:                    end},
 2534:          #{desc => "create socket 4",
 2535:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2536:                          type     := Type, 
 2537:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2538:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2539:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2540:                                    {ok, State#{sock4 => Sock}};
 2541:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2542:                                    ERROR
 2543:                            end
 2544:                    end},
 2545:          #{desc => "create socket 5",
 2546:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2547:                          type     := Type, 
 2548:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2549:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2550:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2551:                                    {ok, State#{sock5 => Sock}};
 2552:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2553:                                    ERROR
 2554:                            end
 2555:                    end},
 2556:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 2557:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 2558: 			 sock1  := Sock1,
 2559: 			 sock2  := Sock2,
 2560: 			 sock3  := Sock3,
 2561: 			 sock4  := Sock4,
 2562: 			 sock5  := Sock5} = _State) ->
 2563: 			   Socks = [Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5],
 2564:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Socks),
 2565:                            ok
 2566:                    end},
 2567: 
 2568:          %% The actual test
 2569:          #{desc => "await continue (close1)",
 2570:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2571:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close1)
 2572:                    end},
 2573:          #{desc => "close socket 1",
 2574:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock} = State) ->
 2575:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 2576: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock1, State)}
 2577:                    end},
 2578: 
 2579:          #{desc => "await continue (close3)",
 2580:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2581:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close3)
 2582:                    end},
 2583:          #{desc => "close socket 3",
 2584:            cmd  => fun(#{sock3 := Sock} = State) ->
 2585:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 2586: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock3, State)}
 2587:                    end},
 2588: 
 2589:          #{desc => "await continue (close5)",
 2590:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2591:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close5)
 2592:                    end},
 2593:          #{desc => "close socket 5",
 2594:            cmd  => fun(#{sock5 := Sock} = State) ->
 2595:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 2596: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock5, State)}
 2597:                    end},
 2598: 
 2599:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 2600:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 2601:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 2602:                                ok ->
 2603:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 2604:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2605:                                    ERROR
 2606:                            end
 2607:                    end},
 2608: 
 2609:          %% *** We are done ***
 2610:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 2611:         ],
 2612: 
 2613:     TesterSeq =
 2614:         [
 2615:          %% *** Init part ***
 2616:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 2617:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 2618:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 2619:                            ok
 2620:                    end},
 2621:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 2622:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2623:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 2624:                            ok
 2625:                    end},
 2626:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 2627:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 2628:                            {ok, [Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5]} =
 2629: 			       ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 2630:                            {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock1,
 2631: 				       sock2 => Sock2,
 2632: 				       sock3 => Sock3,
 2633: 				       sock4 => Sock4,
 2634: 				       sock5 => Sock5}}
 2635:                    end},
 2636:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 2637:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2638: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2639: 			   ok
 2640:                    end},
 2641:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 2642:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2643: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2644: 			   ok
 2645:                    end},
 2646:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 2647:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock1,
 2648: 			 sock2 := Sock2,
 2649: 			 sock3 := Sock3,
 2650: 			 sock4 := Sock4,
 2651: 			 sock5 := Sock5} = State) ->
 2652:                            MRef1 = socket:monitor(Sock1),
 2653:                            MRef2 = socket:monitor(Sock2),
 2654:                            MRef3 = socket:monitor(Sock3),
 2655:                            MRef4 = socket:monitor(Sock4),
 2656:                            MRef5 = socket:monitor(Sock5),
 2657: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitors:"
 2658: 				       "~n   1: ~p"
 2659: 				       "~n   2: ~p"
 2660: 				       "~n   3: ~p"
 2661: 				       "~n   4: ~p"
 2662: 				       "~n   5: ~p",
 2663: 				       [MRef1, MRef2, MRef3, MRef4, MRef5]),
 2664: 			   {ok, State#{mon1 => MRef1,
 2665: 				       mon2 => MRef2,
 2666: 				       mon3 => MRef3,
 2667: 				       mon4 => MRef4,
 2668: 				       mon5 => MRef5}}
 2669:                    end},
 2670:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=5)",
 2671:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2672: 			   5 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2673: 			   ok
 2674:                    end},
 2675:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=5)",
 2676:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2677: 			   5 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2678: 			   ok
 2679:                    end},
 2680: 
 2681:          %% The actual test
 2682:          #{desc => "demonitor socket(s)",
 2683:            cmd  => fun(#{mon2 := MRef2,
 2684: 			 mon4 := MRef4} = State) ->
 2685:                            true = socket:cancel_monitor(MRef2),
 2686:                            true = socket:cancel_monitor(MRef4),
 2687: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("cancel socket monitor 2 and 4"),
 2688: 			   State2 = maps:remove(mon2,  State),
 2689: 			   State3 = maps:remove(sock2, State2),
 2690: 			   State4 = maps:remove(mon4,  State3),
 2691: 			   State5 = maps:remove(sock4, State4),
 2692: 			   {ok, State5}
 2693:                    end},
 2694:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=3)",
 2695:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2696: 			   3 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2697: 			   ok
 2698:                    end},
 2699:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=3)",
 2700:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2701: 			   3 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2702: 			   ok
 2703:                    end},
 2704:          #{desc => "order owner to close socket 1",
 2705:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2706:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close1),
 2707:                            ok
 2708:                    end},

 2714: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
