 2717: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2718: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2719: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock1, State),
 2720: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon1,  State2),
 2721: 				   {ok, State3}
 2722: 			   after 5000 ->
 2723: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2724: 				   {error, timeout}
 2725: 			   end
 2726:                    end},

 2741:                            ok
 2742:                    end},
 2743:          #{desc => "await socket 3 down",
 2744:            cmd  => fun(#{sock3 := Sock,
 2745: 			 mon3  := MRef} = State) ->
 2746: 			   receive
 2747: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2748: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2749: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2750: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2751: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2752: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2753: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock3, State),
 2754: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon3,  State2),
 2755: 				   {ok, State3}

 2758: 				   {error, timeout}
 2759: 			   end
 2760:                    end},
 2761:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=1)",
 2762:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2763: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2764: 			   ok
 2765:                    end},
 2766:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
 2767:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2768: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2769: 			   ok
 2770:                    end},
 2771: 
 2772:          #{desc => "order owner to close socket 5",
 2773:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2774:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close5),
 2775:                            ok
 2776:                    end},
 2777:          #{desc => "await socket 5 down",
 2778:            cmd  => fun(#{sock5 := Sock,
 2779: 			 mon5  := MRef} = State) ->
 2780: 			   receive
 2781: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2782: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2783: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2784: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2785: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2786: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2787: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock5, State),
 2788: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon5,  State2),
 2789: 				   {ok, State3}
 2790: 			   after 5000 ->
 2791: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2792: 				   {error, timeout}
 2793: 			   end
 2794:                    end},
 2795:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",

 2797: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),

 2799:                    end},
 2800:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",

 2804:                    end},
 2805: 
 2806:          %% Cleanup

 2810:                            ok
 2811:                    end},
 2812: 
 2813:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",

 2815:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 2816:                                ok ->
 2817:                                    ok;

 2819:                                    ERROR

 2823:          %% *** We are done ***
 2824:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 2825:         ],

 2832:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),

 2834:     i("await evaluator"),

 2838: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2839: %% Create one socket (by 'owner' process), monitor from several different
 2840: %% processes, then close socket (from 'owner').
 2841: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 2842: 
 2843: monitor_open_and_close_multi_mon(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 2844:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 2845:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_close_multi_mon,
 2846:            fun() ->
 2847: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 2848:                                  type     => stream,
 2849:                                  protocol => tcp},
 2850:                    ok = mon_open_and_close_multi_mon(InitState)
 2851:            end).
 2852: 
 2853: 
 2854: mon_open_and_close_multi_mon(InitState) ->
 2855:     OwnerSeq =
 2856:         [
 2857:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 2858:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 2859:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 2860:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 2861:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 2862:                    end},

 2865:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 2866:                            ok
 2867:                    end},

 2869:          %% *** Init part ***
 2870:          #{desc => "create socket",
 2871:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain,

 2873:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2874:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2875:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2876:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 2877:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2878:                                    ERROR
 2879:                            end
 2880:                    end},
 2881:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 2882:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 2883:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 2884:                            ok
 2885:                    end},
 2886: 
 2887:          %% The actual test
 2888:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 2889:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2890:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 2891:                    end},
 2892: 
 2893:          #{desc => "close socket",
 2894:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 2895:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 2896: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 2897:                    end},

 2904:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};

 2906:                                    ERROR
 2907:                            end

 3406:     Client3 = ?SEV_START("client-3", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3407: 
 3408:     i("start client 4 evaluator"),
 3409:     Client4 = ?SEV_START("client-4", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3410: 
 3411:     i("start client 5 evaluator"),
 3412:     Client5 = ?SEV_START("client-5", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3413: 
 3414:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 3415:     TesterInitState = #{owner   => Owner#ev.pid,
 3416: 			client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 3417: 			client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 3418: 			client3 => Client3#ev.pid,
 3419: 			client4 => Client4#ev.pid,
 3420: 			client5 => Client5#ev.pid},
 3421:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 3422: 
 3423:     i("await evaluator"),
 3424:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 3425: 
 3426: 
 3427: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3428: %% Create one socket (by 'owner' process), monitor from several different
 3429: %% processes, then close socket (from 'owner').
 3430: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 3431: 
 3432: monitor_open_and_exit_multi_mon(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 3433:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 3434:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_exit_multi_mon,
 3435:            fun() ->
 3436: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 3437:                                  type     => stream,
 3438:                                  protocol => tcp},
 3439:                    ok = mon_open_and_exit_multi_mon(InitState)
 3440:            end).
 3441: 
 3442: 
 3443: mon_open_and_exit_multi_mon(InitState) ->
 3444:     OwnerSeq =
 3445:         [
 3446:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 3447:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 3448:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 3449:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 3450:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 3451:                    end},
 3452:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 3453:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 3454:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 3455:                            ok
 3456:                    end},
 3457: 
 3458:          %% *** Init part ***
 3459:          #{desc => "create socket",
 3460:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 3461:                          type     := Type, 
 3462:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 3463:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 3464:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 3465:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 3466:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3467:                                    ERROR
 3468:                            end
 3469:                    end},
 3470:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 3471:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 3472:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 3473:                            ok
 3474:                    end},
 3475: 
 3476:          %% The actual test
 3477:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 3478:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 3479:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 3480:                                ok ->
 3481:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 3482:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3483:                                    ERROR
 3484:                            end
 3485:                    end},
 3486: 
 3487:          %% *** We are done ***
 3488:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 3489:         ],
 3490: 
 3491: 
 3492:     ClientSeq =
 3493:         [
 3494:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 3495:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 3496:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 3497:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 3498:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 3499:                    end},
 3500:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 3501:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 3502:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 3503:                            ok
 3504:                    end},
 3505: 
 3506:          %% *** Init part ***
 3507:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 3508:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 3509:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 3510:                            ok
 3511:                    end},
 3512:          #{desc => "await continue (socket)",
 3513:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 3514:                            {ok, Sock} =
 3515: 			       ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, socket),
 3516: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Socket: ~p", [Sock]),
 3517: 			   {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 3518:                    end},
 3519: 
 3520: 
 3521:          %% The actual test
 3522:          #{desc => "await continue (monitor)",
 3523:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 3524:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, monitor)
 3525:                    end},
 3526:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 3527:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 3528: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 3529: 			   ok
 3530:                    end},
 3531:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 3532:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 3533:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
 3534: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor: ~p", [MRef]),
 3535: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
 3536:                    end},
 3537:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
 3538:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 3539: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 3540: 			   ok
 3541:                    end},
 3542: 
 3543:          #{desc => "announce ready (monitor)",
 3544:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 3545:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, monitor),
 3546:                            ok
 3547:                    end},
 3548: 
 3549:          #{desc => "await continue (down)",
 3550:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 3551:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, down)
 3552:                    end},
 3553: 
 3554:          #{desc => "await socket down",
 3555:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 3556: 			 mon  := MRef} = State) ->
 3557: 			   receive
 3558: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 3559: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 3560: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 3561: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 3562: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 3563: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 3564: 				   State2 = maps:remove(mon, State),
 3565: 				   State3 = maps:remove(sock, State2),
 3566: 				   {ok, State3}
 3567: 			   after 5000 ->
 3568: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 3569: 				   {error, timeout}
 3570: 			   end
 3571:                    end},
 3572:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 3573:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 3574: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 3575: 			   ok
 3576:                    end},
 3577: 
 3578:          #{desc => "announce ready (down)",
 3579:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 3580:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, down),
 3581:                            ok
 3582:                    end},
 3583: 
 3584: 
 3585:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 3586:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 3587:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 3588:                                ok ->
 3589:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 3590:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3591:                                    ERROR
 3592:                            end
 3593:                    end},
 3594: 
 3595:          %% *** We are done ***
 3596:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 3597:         ],

 3953:     Client1 = ?SEV_START("client-1", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3954: 
 3955:     i("start client 2 evaluator"),
 3956:     Client2 = ?SEV_START("client-2", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3957: 
 3958:     i("start client 3 evaluator"),
 3959:     Client3 = ?SEV_START("client-3", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3960: 
 3961:     i("start client 4 evaluator"),
 3962:     Client4 = ?SEV_START("client-4", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3963: 
 3964:     i("start client 5 evaluator"),
 3965:     Client5 = ?SEV_START("client-5", ClientSeq, InitState),
 3966: 
 3967:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 3968:     TesterInitState = #{owner   => Owner#ev.pid,
 3969: 			client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 3970: 			client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 3971: 			client3 => Client3#ev.pid,
 3972: 			client4 => Client4#ev.pid,
 3973: 			client5 => Client5#ev.pid},
 3974:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 3975: 
 3976:     i("await evaluator"),
 3977:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 3978: 
 3979: 
 3980: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3981: %% Create several sockets (by 'owner' process), monitor each from several
 3982: %% different processes, then close each socket (from 'owner').
 3983: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive one socket DOWN for
 3984: %% each socket.
 3985: 
 3986: monitor_open_and_close_multi_socks_and_mon(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3987:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 3988:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 3989:            fun() ->
 3990:                    FactorKey = kernel_factor,
 3991:                    case lists:keysearch(FactorKey, 1, Config) of
 3992:                        {value, {FactorKey, Factor}} when (Factor > 15) ->
 3993:                            skip("Very slow machine");
 3994:                        _ ->
 3995:                            ok
 3996:                    end
 3997:            end,
 3998:            fun() ->
 3999: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 4000:                                  type     => stream,
 4001:                                  protocol => tcp},
 4002:                    ok = mon_open_and_close_multi_socks_and_mon(InitState)
 4003:            end).
 4004: 
 4005: 
 4006: mon_open_and_close_multi_socks_and_mon(InitState) ->
 4007:     OwnerSeq =
 4008:         [
 4009:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 4010:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 4011:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 4012:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 4013:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 4014:                    end},
 4015:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 4016:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 4017:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 4018:                            ok
 4019:                    end},
 4020: 
 4021:          %% *** Init part ***
 4022:          #{desc => "create socket 1",
 4023:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4024:                          type     := Type, 
 4025:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4026:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4027:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4028:                                    {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock}};
 4029:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4030:                                    ERROR
 4031:                            end
 4032:                    end},
 4033:          #{desc => "create socket 2",
 4034:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4035:                          type     := Type, 
 4036:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4037:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4038:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4039:                                    {ok, State#{sock2 => Sock}};
 4040:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4041:                                    ERROR
 4042:                            end
 4043:                    end},
 4044:          #{desc => "create socket 3",
 4045:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4046:                          type     := Type, 
 4047:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4048:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4049:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4050:                                    {ok, State#{sock3 => Sock}};
 4051:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4052:                                    ERROR
 4053:                            end
 4054:                    end},
 4055:          #{desc => "create socket 4",
 4056:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4057:                          type     := Type, 
 4058:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4059:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4060:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4061:                                    {ok, State#{sock4 => Sock}};
 4062:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4063:                                    ERROR
 4064:                            end
 4065:                    end},
 4066:          #{desc => "create socket 5",
 4067:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4068:                          type     := Type, 
 4069:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4070:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4071:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4072:                                    {ok, State#{sock5 => Sock}};
 4073:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4074:                                    ERROR
 4075:                            end
 4076:                    end},
 4077:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 4078:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 4079: 			 sock1  := Sock1,
 4080: 			 sock2  := Sock2,
 4081: 			 sock3  := Sock3,
 4082: 			 sock4  := Sock4,
 4083: 			 sock5  := Sock5} = _State) ->
 4084: 			   Socks = [Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5],
 4085:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Socks),
 4086:                            ok
 4087:                    end},
 4088: 
 4089:          %% The actual test
 4090:          #{desc => "await continue (close1)",
 4091:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 4092:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close1)
 4093:                    end},
 4094:          #{desc => "close socket 1",
 4095:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock} = State) ->
 4096:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 4097: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock1, State)}
 4098:                    end},
 4099: 
 4100:          #{desc => "await continue (close2)",
 4101:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 4102:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close2)
 4103:                    end},
 4104:          #{desc => "close socket 2",
 4105:            cmd  => fun(#{sock2 := Sock} = State) ->
 4106:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 4107: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock2, State)}
 4108:                    end},
 4109: 
 4110:          #{desc => "await continue (close3)",
 4111:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 4112:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close3)
 4113:                    end},
 4114:          #{desc => "close socket 3",
 4115:            cmd  => fun(#{sock3 := Sock} = State) ->
 4116:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 4117: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock3, State)}
 4118:                    end},
 4119: 
 4120:          #{desc => "await continue (close4)",
 4121:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 4122:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close4)
 4123:                    end},
 4124:          #{desc => "close socket 4",
 4125:            cmd  => fun(#{sock4 := Sock} = State) ->
 4126:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 4127: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock4, State)}
 4128:                    end},
 4129: 
 4130:          #{desc => "await continue (close5)",
 4131:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 4132:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close5)
 4133:                    end},
 4134:          #{desc => "close socket 5",
 4135:            cmd  => fun(#{sock5 := Sock} = State) ->
 4136:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 4137: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock5, State)}
 4138:                    end},
 4139: 
 4140: 
 4141:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 4142:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 4143:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 4144:                                ok ->
 4145:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 4146:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4147:                                    ERROR
 4148:                            end
 4149:                    end},
 4150: 
 4151:          %% *** We are done ***
 4152:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 4153:         ],

 4224: 			   {ok, State#{mon1 => MRef1,
 4225: 				       mon2 => MRef2,
 4226: 				       mon3 => MRef3,
 4227: 				       mon4 => MRef4,
 4228: 				       mon5 => MRef5}}

 4912:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 4913:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 4914: 
 4915:     i("start client 1 evaluator"),
 4916:     Client1 = ?SEV_START("client-1", ClientSeq, InitState),
 4917: 
 4918:     i("start client 2 evaluator"),
 4919:     Client2 = ?SEV_START("client-2", ClientSeq, InitState),
 4920: 
 4921:     i("start client 3 evaluator"),

 4923:

 4926: 
 4927:     i("start client 5 evaluator"),
 4928:     Client5 = ?SEV_START("client-5", ClientSeq, InitState),
 4929: 
 4930:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 4931:     TesterInitState = #{owner   => Owner#ev.pid,
 4932: 			client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 4933: 			client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 4934: 			client3 => Client3#ev.pid,
 4935: 			client4 => Client4#ev.pid,
 4936: 			client5 => Client5#ev.pid},
 4937:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 4938: 
 4939:     i("await evaluator"),
 4940:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).

 4942: 
 4943: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4944: %% Create several sockets (by 'owner' process), monitor each from several
 4945: %% different processes, then exit the owner.
 4946: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive one socket DOWN for
 4947: %% each socket.
 4948: 
 4949: monitor_open_and_exit_multi_socks_and_mon(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4950:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 4951:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 4952:            fun() ->
 4953:                    FactorKey = kernel_factor,
 4954:                    case lists:keysearch(FactorKey, 1, Config) of
 4955:                        {value, {FactorKey, Factor}} when (Factor > 15) ->
 4956:                            skip("Very slow machine");
 4957:                        _ ->
 4958:                            ok
 4959:                    end
 4960:            end,
 4961:            fun() ->
 4962: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 4963:                                  type     => stream,
 4964:                                  protocol => tcp},
 4965:                    ok = mon_open_and_exit_multi_socks_and_mon(InitState)
 4966:            end).
 4967: 
 4968: 
 4969: mon_open_and_exit_multi_socks_and_mon(InitState) ->
 4970:     OwnerSeq =
 4971:         [
 4972:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 4973:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 4974:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 4975:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 4976:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 4977:                    end},
 4978:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 4979:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 4980:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 4981:                            ok
 4982:                    end},
 4983: 
 4984:          %% *** Init part ***
 4985:          #{desc => "create socket 1",
 4986:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4987:                          type     := Type, 
 4988:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4989:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4990:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4991:                                    {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock}};
 4992:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4993:                                    ERROR
 4994:                            end
 4995:                    end},
 4996:          #{desc => "create socket 2",
 4997:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4998:                          type     := Type, 
 4999:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 5000:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 5001:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 5002:                                    {ok, State#{sock2 => Sock}};
 5003:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5004:                                    ERROR
 5005:                            end
 5006:                    end},
 5007:          #{desc => "create socket 3",
 5008:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 5009:                          type     := Type, 
 5010:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 5011:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 5012:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 5013:                                    {ok, State#{sock3 => Sock}};
 5014:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5015:                                    ERROR
 5016:                            end
 5017:                    end},
 5018:          #{desc => "create socket 4",

 5549:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 5550:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5551:                                ok ->
 5552:                                    {ok, maps:remove(owner, State)};
 5553:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5554:                                    ERROR
 5555:                            end
 5556:                    end},
 5557: 
 5558:          #{desc => "await (client 1) ready",
 5559:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5560:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client1, down)
 5561:                    end},
 5562:          #{desc => "await (client 2) ready",
 5563:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5564:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client2, down)
 5565:                    end},
 5566:          #{desc => "await (client 3) ready",
 5567:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5568:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client3, down)
 5569:                    end},
 5570:          #{desc => "await (client 4) ready",
 5571:            cmd  => fun(#{client4 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5572:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client4, down)
 5573:                    end},
 5574:          #{desc => "await (client 5) ready",
 5575:            cmd  => fun(#{client5 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5576:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client5, down)
 5577:                    end},
 5578: 
 5579: 	 #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 5580:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 5581: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 5582: 			   ok
 5583:                    end},
 5584: 
 5585: 	 ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 5586: 
 5587:          %% Cleanup
 5588:          #{desc => "order (client 1) terminate",
 5589:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5590:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5591:                            ok
 5592:                    end},
 5593:          #{desc => "await (client 1) termination",
 5594:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = State) ->
 5595:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5596:                                ok ->
 5597:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client1, State)};
 5598:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5599:                                    ERROR
 5600:                            end
 5601:                    end},
 5602: 
 5603:          #{desc => "order (client 2) terminate",
 5604:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5605:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5606:                            ok
 5607:                    end},
 5608:          #{desc => "await (client 2) termination",
 5609:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = State) ->
 5610:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5611:                                ok ->
 5612:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client2, State)};
 5613:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5614:                                    ERROR
 5615:                            end
 5616:                    end},
 5617: 
 5618:          #{desc => "order (client 3) terminate",
 5619:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5620:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5621:                            ok
 5622:                    end},
 5623:          #{desc => "await (client 3) termination",
 5624:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = State) ->
 5625:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5626:                                ok ->
 5627:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client3, State)};
 5628:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5629:                                    ERROR
 5630:                            end
 5631:                    end},
 5632: 
 5633:          #{desc => "order (client 4) terminate",
 5634:            cmd  => fun(#{client4 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5635:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5636:                            ok
 5637:                    end},
 5638:          #{desc => "await (client 4) termination",
 5639:            cmd  => fun(#{client4 := Pid} = State) ->
 5640:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5641:                                ok ->
 5642:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client4, State)};
 5643:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5644:                                    ERROR
 5645:                            end
 5646:                    end},
 5647: 
 5648:          #{desc => "order (client 5) terminate",
 5649:            cmd  => fun(#{client5 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5650:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5651:                            ok
 5652:                    end},
 5653:          #{desc => "await (client 5) termination",
 5654:            cmd  => fun(#{client5 := Pid} = State) ->
 5655:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5656:                                ok ->
 5657:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client5, State)};
 5658:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5659:                                    ERROR
 5660:                            end
 5661:                    end},
 5662: 
 5663:          %% *** We are done ***
 5664:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5665:         ],
 5666: 
 5667:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 5668:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 5669: 
 5670:     i("start client 1 evaluator"),
 5671:     Client1 = ?SEV_START("client-1", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5672: 
 5673:     i("start client 2 evaluator"),
 5674:     Client2 = ?SEV_START("client-2", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5675: 
 5676:     i("start client 3 evaluator"),
 5677:     Client3 = ?SEV_START("client-3", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5678: 
 5679:     i("start client 4 evaluator"),
 5680:     Client4 = ?SEV_START("client-4", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5681: 
 5682:     i("start client 5 evaluator"),
 5683:     Client5 = ?SEV_START("client-5", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5684: 
 5685:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 5686:     TesterInitState = #{owner   => Owner#ev.pid,
 5687: 			client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 5688: 			client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 5689: 			client3 => Client3#ev.pid,
 5690: 			client4 => Client4#ev.pid,
 5691: 			client5 => Client5#ev.pid},
 5692:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 5693: 
 5694:     i("await evaluator"),
 5695:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 5696: 
 5697: 
 5698: 
 5699: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5700: %% Create several sockets (by 'owner' process), monitor each from several
 5701: %% different processes, then exit the owner.
 5702: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive one socket DOWN for
 5703: %% each socket.
 5704: 
 5705: monitor_closed_socket(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 5706:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
 5707:     tc_try(monitor_closed_socket,
 5708:            fun() ->
 5709: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 5710:                                  type     => stream,
 5711:                                  protocol => tcp},
 5712:                    ok = mon_closed_socket(InitState)
 5713:            end).
 5714: 
 5715: 
 5716: mon_closed_socket(InitState) ->
 5717:     OwnerSeq =
 5718:         [
 5719:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 5720:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 5721:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 5722:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 5723:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 5724:                    end},
 5725:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 5726:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 5727:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 5728:                            ok
 5729:                    end},
 5730: 
 5731:          %% *** Init part ***
 5732:          #{desc => "create socket",
 5733:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 5734:                          type     := Type, 
 5735:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 5736:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 5737:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 5738:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 5739:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5740:                                    ERROR
 5741:                            end
 5742:                    end},
 5743:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 5744:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 5745: 			 sock   := Sock} = State) ->
 5746:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 5747:                            (catch socket:close(Sock)),
 5748:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 5749:                    end},
 5750: 
 5751:          %% The actual test
 5752:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 5753:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 5754:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 5755:                                ok ->
 5756:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 5757:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5758:                                    ERROR
 5759:                            end
 5760:                    end},
 5761: 
 5762:          %% *** We are done ***
 5763:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5764:         ],
 5765: 
 5766: 
 5767:     ClientSeq =
 5768:         [
 5769:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 5770:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 5771:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 5772:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 5773:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 5774:                    end},
 5775:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 5776:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 5777:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 5778:                            ok
 5779:                    end},
 5780: 
 5781:          %% *** Init part ***
 5782:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 5783:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 5784:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 5785:                            ok
 5786:                    end},
 5787:          #{desc => "await continue (socket)",
 5788:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 5789:                            {ok, Sock} =
 5790:                                ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, socket),
 5791: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Socket: "
 5792: 				       "~n      ~p", [Sock]),
 5793: 			   {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 5794:                    end},
 5795: 
 5796: 
 5797:          %% The actual test
 5798:          #{desc => "await continue (monitor)",
 5799:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5800:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, monitor)
 5801:                    end},
 5802: 
 5803:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 5804:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 5805:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
 5806: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitors: "
 5807: 				       "~n      ~p", [MRef]),
 5808: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
 5809:                    end},
 5810:          
 5811:          #{desc => "announce ready (monitor)",
 5812:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5813:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, monitor),
 5814:                            ok
 5815:                    end},
 5816: 
 5817:          #{desc => "await continue (down)",
 5818:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5819:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, down)
 5820:                    end},
 5821: 
 5822:          #{desc => "await socket down",
 5823:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 5824: 			 mon  := MRef} = State) ->
 5825: 			   receive
 5826: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 5827: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 5828: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 5829: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 5830: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 5831: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 5832: 				   State2 = maps:remove(mon,  State),
 5833: 				   State3 = maps:remove(sock, State2),
 5834: 				   {ok, State3}
 5835: 			   after 1000 ->
 5836: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 5837: 				   {error, timeout}
 5838: 			   end
 5839:                    end},
 5840: 
 5841:          #{desc => "announce ready (down)",
 5842:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5843:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, down),
 5844:                            ok
 5845:                    end},
 5846: 
 5847: 
 5848:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 5849:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 5850:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 5851:                                ok ->
 5852:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 5853:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5854:                                    ERROR
 5855:                            end
 5856:                    end},
 5857: 
 5858:          %% *** We are done ***
 5859:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5860:         ],
 5861: 
 5862:     TesterSeq =
 5863:         [
 5864:          %% *** Init part ***
 5865:          #{desc => "monitor 'owner'",
 5866:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 5867:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 5868:                            ok
 5869:                    end},
 5870:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 5871:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 5872:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 5873:                            ok
 5874:                    end},
 5875:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 5876:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 5877:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 5878:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 5879:                    end},
 5880: 
 5881:          #{desc => "monitor client",
 5882:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5883:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 5884:                            ok
 5885:                    end},
 5886:          #{desc => "order client start",
 5887:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5888:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 5889:                            ok
 5890:                    end},
 5891:          #{desc => "await client ready",
 5892:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5893:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, init)
 5894:                    end},
 5895:          #{desc => "send socket to client",
 5896:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid,
 5897: 			 sock   := Sock} = _State) ->
 5898:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, socket, Sock),
 5899:                            ok
 5900:                    end},
 5901: 
 5902:          %% The actual test
 5903:          %% There is no way we can actually know that the "system"
 5904:          %% does not create *any* sockets...
 5905:          #{desc => "order client to monitor",
 5906:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5907:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, monitor),
 5908:                            ok
 5909:                    end},
 5910:          #{desc => "await client ready",
 5911:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5912:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, monitor)
 5913:                    end},
 5914: 
 5915:          #{desc => "order client to await down",
 5916:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5917:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, down),
 5918:                            ok
 5919:                    end},
 5920: 
 5921: 	 ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 5922: 
 5923:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 5924:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 5925:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5926:                            ok
 5927:                    end},
 5928:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 5929:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 5930:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5931:                                ok ->
 5932:                                    {ok, maps:remove(owner, State)};
 5933:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5934:                                    ERROR
 5935:                            end
 5936:                    end},
 5937: 
 5938:          #{desc => "await client ready",
 5939:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5940:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, down)
 5941:                    end},
 5942: 
 5943: 	 #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 5944:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 5945: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 5946: 			   ok
 5947:                    end},
 5948: 
 5949: 	 ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 5950: 
 5951:          %% Cleanup
 5952:          #{desc => "order client terminate",
 5953:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5954:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5955:                            ok
 5956:                    end},
 5957:          #{desc => "await client termination",
 5958:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = State) ->
 5959:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5960:                                ok ->
 5961:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client, State)};
 5962:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5963:                                    ERROR
 5964:                            end
 5965:                    end},
 5966: 
 5967:          %% *** We are done ***
 5968:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5969:         ],
 5970: 
 5971:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 5972:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 5973: 
 5974:     i("start client  evaluator"),
 5975:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5976: 
 5977:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 5978:     TesterInitState = #{owner  => Owner#ev.pid,
 5979: 			client => Client#ev.pid},
 5980:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 5981: 
 5982:     i("await evaluator"),
 5983:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Client, Tester]).
 5984:

 5987: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5988: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5989: %%                                                                     %%
 5990: %%                         SOCKET CLOSURE                              %%

 5994: 
 5995: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5996: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 5997: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 5998: %% calling the close function). For a IPv4 TCP (stream) socket.
 5999: 
 6000: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6001:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6002:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp4,
 6003:            fun() ->
 6004:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 6005:                                  type     => stream,
 6006:                                  protocol => tcp},
 6007:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6008:            end).
 6009: 
 6010: 
 6011: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6012: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6013: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6014: %% calling the close function). For a IPv6 TCP (stream) socket.
 6015: 
 6016: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6017:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6018:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp6,
 6019:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 6020:            fun() ->
 6021:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 6022:                                  type     => stream,
 6023:                                  protocol => tcp},
 6024:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6025:            end).
 6026: 
 6027: 
 6028: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6029: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6030: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6031: %% calling the close function). For a Unix Domain (stream) socket (TCP).
 6032: 
 6033: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6034:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6035:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcpL,
 6036:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
 6037:            fun() ->
 6038:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 6039:                                  type     => stream,
 6040:                                  protocol => default},
 6041:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6042:            end).
 6043: 
 6044: 
 6045: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6046: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6047: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6048: %% calling the close function). For a IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket.
 6049: 
 6050: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6051:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6052:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp4,
 6053:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 6054:            fun() ->
 6055:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 6056:                                  type     => dgram,
 6057:                                  protocol => udp},
 6058:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6059:            end).
 6060: 
 6061: 
 6062: 
 6063: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6064: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6065: %% (removed) when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6066: %% calling the close function). For a IPv6 UDP (dgram) socket.
 6067: 
 6068: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6069:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6070:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp6,
 6071:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 6072:            fun() ->
 6073:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 6074:                                  type     => dgram,
 6075:                                  protocol => udp},
 6076:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6077:            end).
 6078: 
 6079: 
 6080: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6081: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6082: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6083: %% calling the close function). For a Unix Domain (dgram) socket (UDP).
 6084: 
 6085: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6086:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6087:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udpL,
 6088:            fun() ->
 6089: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket(),
 6090: 		   is_not_windows()
 6091: 	   end,
 6092:            fun() ->
 6093:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 6094:                                  type     => dgram,
 6095:                                  protocol => default},
 6096:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6097:            end).
 6098: 
 6099: 
 6100: 
 6101: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6102: 
 6103: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState) ->
 6104:     OwnerSeq =
 6105:         [
 6106:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 6107:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 6108:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 6109:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 6110:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 6111:                    end},
 6112:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 6113:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6114:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 6115:                            ok
 6116:                    end},
 6117: 
 6118:          %% *** Init part ***
 6119:          #{desc => "create socket",
 6120:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 6121:                          type     := Type, 
 6122:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 6123:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 6124:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 6125:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 6126:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6127:                                    ERROR
 6128:                            end
 6129:                    end},
 6130:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 6131:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 6132:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 6133:                            ok
 6134:                    end},
 6135: 
 6136:          %% *** The actual test ***
 6137:          %% We *intentionally* leave the socket "as is", no explicit close
 6138:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 6139:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6140:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 6141:                                ok ->
 6142:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 6143:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6144:                                    ERROR
 6145:                            end
 6146:                    end},
 6147: 
 6148:          %% *** We are done ***
 6149:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6150:         ],
 6151: 
 6152:     TesterSeq =
 6153:         [
 6154:          %% *** Init part ***
 6155:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 6156:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 6157:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 6158:                            ok
 6159:                    end},
 6160:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 6161:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 6162:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 6163:                            ok
 6164:                    end},
 6165:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 6166:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 6167:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 6168:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 6169:                    end},
 6170:          #{desc => "verify owner as controlling-process",
 6171:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 6172:                            case socket:getopt(Sock, otp, controlling_process) of
 6173:                                {ok, Pid} ->
 6174:                                    ok;
 6175:                                {ok, Other} ->
 6176:                                    {error, {unexpected_owner, Other}};
 6177:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6178:                                    ERROR
 6179:                            end
 6180:                    end},
 6181:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 6182:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 6183:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6184:                            ok
 6185:                    end},
 6186:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 6187:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 6188:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6189:                                ok ->
 6190:                                    ok;
 6191:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6192:                                    ERROR
 6193:                            end
 6194:                    end},
 6195: 
 6196:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(5)),
 6197: 
 6198:          %% The reason we get closed, is that as long as there is a ref to 
 6199:          %% the resource (socket), then it will not be garbage collected.
 6200:          %% Note that its still a race that the nif has processed that the
 6201:          %% "controlling process" has terminated. There really is no 
 6202:          %% proper timeout for this, but the 5 seconds "should" be enough...
 6203:          %% We should really have some way to subscribe to socket events...
 6204:          #{desc => "verify no socket (closed)",
 6205:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 6206:                            case socket:getopt(Sock, otp, controlling_process) of
 6207:                                {ok, OtherPid} ->
 6208:                                    {error, {unexpected_success, Pid, OtherPid}};
 6209:                                {error, closed} ->
 6210:                                    ok;
 6211:                                {error, Reason} ->
 6212:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected failure: ~p", [Reason]),
 6213:                                    {error, {unexpected_failure, Reason}}
 6214:                            end
 6215:                    end},
 6216: 
 6217:          %% *** We are done ***
 6218:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6219:         ],
 6220: 
 6221:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 6222:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 6223: 
 6224:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 6225:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 6226:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 6227: 
 6228:     i("await evaluator"),
 6229:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 6230: 
 6231: 
 6232: 
 6233: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6234: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6235: %% locally closed while a process is calling the recv function.
 6236: %% Socket is IPv4.
 6237: %% 
 6238: %% <KOLLA>
 6239: %% 
 6240: %% We should really have a similar test cases for when the controlling
 6241: %% process exits and there are other processes in recv, accept, and 
 6242: %% all the other functions.
 6243: %% 
 6244: %% </KOLLA>
 6245: 
 6246: sc_lc_recv_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6247:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 6248:     tc_try(sc_lc_recv_response_tcp4,
 6249:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 6250:            fun() ->
 6251:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 6252:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 6253:                                  protocol => tcp,
 6254:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6255:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 6256:            end).
 6257: 
 6258: 
 6259: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6260: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6261: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 6262: %% Socket is IPv6.
 6263: 
 6264: sc_lc_recv_response_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6265:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 6266:     tc_try(sc_lc_recv_response_tcp6,
 6267:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 6268:            fun() ->
 6269:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 6270:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 6271:                                  protocol => tcp,
 6272:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6273:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 6274:            end).
 6275:

 6277: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6278: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6279: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 6280: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
 6281: 
 6282: sc_lc_recv_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6283:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 6284:     tc_try(sc_lc_recv_response_tcpL,
 6285:            fun() ->
 6286: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket()
 6287: 	   end,
 6288:            fun() ->
 6289:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 6290:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 6291:                                  protocol => default,
 6292:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6293:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 6294:            end).
