 7548: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7549: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 7550: %% locally closed while the process is calling the accept function.
 7551: %% We test what happens with a non-controlling_process also, since we 
 7552: %% git the setup anyway.
 7553: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
 7554: 
 7555: sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 7556:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 7557:     tc_try(sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcpL,
 7558:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
 7559:            fun() ->
 7560:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 7561:                                  protocol => default},
 7562:                    ok = sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp(InitState)
 7563:            end).
 7564: 
 7565: 
 7566: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7567: 
 7568: sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp(InitState) ->
 7569:     PrimAcceptorSeq =
 7570:         [
 7571:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 7572:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 7573:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 7574:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 7575:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 7576:                    end},
 7577:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 7578:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7579:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 7580:                            ok
 7581:                    end},
 7582: 
 7583:          %% *** Init part ***
 7584:          #{desc => "which local address",
 7585:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 7586:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 7587:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
 7588:                    end},
 7589:          #{desc => "create (listen) socket",
 7590:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 7591:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 7592:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 7593:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 7594:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 7595:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7596:                                    ERROR
 7597:                            end
 7598:                    end},
 7599:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
 7600:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
 7601:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
 7602:                                ok ->
 7603:                                    ok;
 7604:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7605:                                    ERROR
 7606:                            end
 7607:                    end},
 7608:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
 7609:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock}) ->
 7610:                            socket:listen(Sock)
 7611:                    end},
 7612:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 7613:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7614:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 7615:                            ok
 7616:                    end},
 7617: 
 7618:          %% The actual test
 7619:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
 7620:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7621:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept) of
 7622:                                {ok, Timeout} ->
 7623:                                    {ok, State#{timeout => Timeout}};
 7624:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7625:                                    ERROR
 7626:                            end
 7627:                    end},
 7628:          #{desc => "await connection",
 7629:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := LSock, timeout := Timeout} = _State) ->
 7630:                            case socket:accept(LSock, Timeout) of
 7631:                                {error, timeout} ->
 7632:                                    ok;
 7633:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 7634:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected success"),
 7635:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
 7636:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
 7637:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7638:                                    ERROR
 7639:                            end
 7640:                    end},
 7641:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept timeout)",
 7642:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7643:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept_timeout),
 7644:                            ok
 7645:                    end},
 7646:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 7647:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7648:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 7649:                    end},
 7650:          #{desc => "close socket",
 7651:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 7652:                          sock   := Sock,
 7653:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 7654:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
 7655:                                ok ->
 7656:                                    State1 =
 7657:                                        unlink_path(Path,
 7658:                                                    fun() ->
 7659:                                                            maps:remove(lsa, State)
 7660:                                                    end,
 7661:                                                    fun() ->
 7662:                                                            State
 7663:                                                    end),
 7664:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State1)};
 7665:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7666:                                    unlink_path(Path),
 7667:                                    ERROR
 7668:                            end;
 7669:                       (#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 7670:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
 7671:                                ok ->
 7672:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
 7673:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7674:                                    ERROR
 7675:                            end
 7676:                    end},
 7677:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
 7678:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7679:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
 7680:                            ok
 7681:                    end},
 7682: 
 7683:                                                 % Termination
 7684:          #{desc => "await terminate",
 7685:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7686:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 7687:                                ok ->
 7688:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 7689:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7690:                                    ERROR
 7691:                            end
 7692:                    end},
 7693: 
 7694:          %% *** We are done ***
 7695:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7696:         ],
 7697: 
 7698:     SecAcceptorSeq =
 7699:         [
 7700:          %% *** Init part ***
 7701:          #{desc => "await start",
 7702:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 7703:                            {Tester, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 7704:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester, sock => Sock}}
 7705:                    end},
 7706:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 7707:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7708:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 7709:                            ok
 7710:                    end},
 7711:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 7712:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7713:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init)
 7714:                    end},
 7715: 
 7716:          %% The actual test
 7717:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
 7718:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7719:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
 7720:                    end},
 7721:          #{desc => "accept",
 7722:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 7723:                            case socket:accept(Sock) of
 7724:                                {error, closed} ->
 7725:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
 7726:                                {ok, _} ->
 7727:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
 7728:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7729:                                    ERROR
 7730:                            end
 7731:                    end},
 7732:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept closed)",
 7733:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7734:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept_closed)
 7735:                    end},
 7736: 
 7737:          %% Termination
 7738:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 7739:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7740:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 7741:                                ok ->
 7742:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 7743:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7744:                                    ERROR
 7745:                            end
 7746:                    end},
 7747: 
 7748:          %% *** We are done ***
 7749:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7750:         ],
 7751: 
 7752:     TesterSeq =
 7753:         [
 7754:          %% *** Init part ***
 7755:          #{desc => "monitor 'primary acceptor'",
 7756:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7757:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7758:                            ok
 7759:                    end},
 7760:          #{desc => "monitor 'secondary acceptor 1'",
 7761:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7762:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7763:                            ok
 7764:                    end},
 7765:          #{desc => "monitor secondary acceptor 2",
 7766:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7767:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7768:                            ok
 7769:                    end},
 7770:          #{desc => "monitor secondary acceptor 3",
 7771:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7772:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7773:                            ok
 7774:                    end},
 7775: 
 7776:          %% Start the primary server
 7777:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' start",
 7778:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7779:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 7780:                            ok
 7781:                    end},
 7782:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' ready (init)",
 7783:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = State) ->
 7784:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acc, init),
 7785:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 7786:                    end},
 7787: 
 7788:          %% Start the secondary acceptor 1
 7789:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 1' start",
 7790:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7791:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7792:                            ok
 7793:                    end},
 7794:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 1' ready (init)",
 7795:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7796:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc1, init)
 7797:                    end},
 7798: 
 7799:          %% Start the secondary acceptor 2
 7800:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 2' start",
 7801:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7802:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7803:                            ok
 7804:                    end},
 7805:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 2' ready (init)",
 7806:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7807:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc2, init)
 7808:                    end},
 7809: 
 7810:          %% Start the secondary acceptor 3
 7811:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 3' start",
 7812:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7813:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7814:                            ok
 7815:                    end},
 7816:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 3' ready (init)",
 7817:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7818:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc3, init)
 7819:                    end},
 7820: 
 7821: 
 7822:          %% The actual test
 7823:          %% Make all the seondary servers continue, with an infinite recvfrom
 7824:          %% and then the prim-server with a timed recvfrom.
 7825:          %% After the prim server notifies us (about the timeout) we order it
 7826:          %% to close the socket, which should cause the all the secondary 
 7827:          %% server to return with error-closed.
 7828: 
 7829:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 1' to continue (accept)",
 7830:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7831:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
 7832:                            ok
 7833:                    end},
 7834:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7835:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 2' to continue (accept)",
 7836:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7837:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
 7838:                            ok
 7839:                    end},
 7840:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7841:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 3' to continue (accept)",
 7842:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7843:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
 7844:                            ok
 7845:                    end},
 7846:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7847:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' to continue",
 7848:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7849:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept, ?SECS(5)),
 7850:                            ok
 7851:                    end},
 7852:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' ready (accept timeout)",
 7853:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7854:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acc, accept_timeout)
 7855:                    end},
 7856:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' to continue (close)",
 7857:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7858:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 7859:                            ok
 7860:                    end},
 7861:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' ready (close)",
 7862:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7863:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acc, close)
 7864:                    end},
 7865:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 1' ready (accept closed)",
 7866:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7867:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc1, accept_closed)
 7868:                    end},
 7869:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 2' ready (accept closed)",
 7870:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7871:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc2, accept_closed)
 7872:                    end},
 7873:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 3' ready (accept closed)",
 7874:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7875:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc3, accept_closed)
 7876:                    end},
 7877: 
 7878: 
 7879:          %% Terminations
 7880:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 3' to terminate",
 7881:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7882:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7883:                            ok
 7884:                    end},
 7885:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 3' termination",
 7886:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = State) ->
 7887:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7888:                                ok ->
 7889:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_acc3, State)};
 7890:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7891:                                    ERROR
 7892:                            end
 7893:                    end},
 7894:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 2' to terminate",
 7895:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7896:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7897:                            ok
 7898:                    end},
 7899:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 2' termination",
 7900:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = State) ->
 7901:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7902:                                ok ->
 7903:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_acc2, State)};
 7904:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7905:                                    ERROR
 7906:                            end
 7907:                    end},
 7908:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 1' to terminate",
 7909:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7910:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7911:                            ok
 7912:                    end},
 7913:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 1' termination",
 7914:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = State) ->
 7915:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7916:                                ok ->
 7917:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_acc1, State)};
 7918:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7919:                                    ERROR
 7920:                            end
 7921:                    end},
 7922:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' to terminate",
 7923:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7924:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7925:                            ok
 7926:                    end},
 7927:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' termination",
 7928:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = State) ->
 7929:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7930:                                ok ->
 7931:                                    {ok, maps:remove(prim_acc, State)};
 7932:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7933:                                    ERROR
 7934:                            end
 7935:                    end},
 7936: 
 7937: 
 7938:          %% *** We are done ***
 7939:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7940:         ],
 7941: 
 7942: 
 7943:     i("start 'primary acceptor' evaluator"),
 7944:     PrimAccInitState = InitState,
 7945:     PrimAcc = ?SEV_START("prim-acceptor", PrimAcceptorSeq, PrimAccInitState),
 7946: 
 7947:     i("start 'secondary acceptor 1' evaluator"),
 7948:     SecAccInitState = #{},
 7949:     SecAcc1 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-1", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAccInitState),
 7950: 
 7951:     i("start 'secondary acceptor 2' evaluator"),
 7952:     SecAcc2 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-2", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAccInitState),
 7953: 
 7954:     i("start 'secondary acceptor 3' evaluator"),
 7955:     SecAcc3 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-3", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAccInitState),
 7956: 
 7957:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 7958:     TesterInitState = #{prim_acc => PrimAcc#ev.pid,
 7959:                         sec_acc1 => SecAcc1#ev.pid,
 7960:                         sec_acc2 => SecAcc2#ev.pid,
 7961:                         sec_acc3 => SecAcc3#ev.pid},
 7962:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 7963: 
 7964:     i("await evaluator"),
 7965:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([PrimAcc, SecAcc1, SecAcc2, SecAcc3, Tester]).
 7966: 
 7967: 
 7968: 
 7969: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7970: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 7971: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 7972: %% Socket is IPv4.
 7973: %%
 7974: %% To minimize the chance of "weirdness", we should really have test cases
 7975: %% where the two sides of the connection is on different machines. But for
 7976: %% now, we will make do with different VMs on the same host.
 7977: %%
 7978: 
 7979: sc_rc_recv_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 7980:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 7981:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 7982:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 7983:            fun() ->
 7984:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 7985:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 7986:                                  protocol => tcp,
 7987:                                  recv     => Recv},
 7988:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 7989:            end).
 7990: 
 7991: 
 7992: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7993: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 7994: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 7995: %% Socket is IPv6.
 7996: 
 7997: sc_rc_recv_response_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 7998:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 7999:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 8000:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 8001:            fun() ->
 8002:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 8003:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 8004:                                  protocol => tcp,
 8005:                                  recv     => Recv},
 8006:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 8007:            end).
 8008: 
 8009: 
 8010: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8011: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 8012: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 8013: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
 8014: 
 8015: sc_rc_recv_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 8016:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 8017:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 8018:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
 8019:            fun() ->
 8020:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 8021:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 8022:                                  protocol => default,
 8023:                                  recv     => Recv},
 8024:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 8025:            end).
 8026: 
 8027: 
 8028: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8029: 
 8030: sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState) ->
 8031:     %% Each connection are handled by handler processes.
 8032:     %% These are created (on the fly) and handled internally 
 8033:     %% by the server!
 8034:     ServerSeq =
 8035:         [
 8036:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 8037:          #{desc => "await start",
 8038:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 8039:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 8040:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 8041:                    end},
 8042:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 8043:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 8044:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 8045:                            ok
 8046:                    end},
 8047: 
 8048:          %% *** Init part ***
 8049:          #{desc => "which local address",
 8050:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 8051:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 8052:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
 8053:                    end},
 8054:          #{desc => "create listen socket",
 8055:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 8056:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 8057:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8058:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
 8059:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8060:                                    ERROR
 8061:                            end
 8062:                    end},
 8063:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
 8064:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 8065:                          lsock  := LSock,
 8066:                          lsa    := LSA} = _State) ->
 8067:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
 8068:                                ok ->
 8069:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
 8070:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8071:                                    ERROR
 8072:                            end;
 8073:                       (#{lsock    := LSock,
 8074:                          local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
 8075:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
 8076:                                ok ->
 8077:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
 8078:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
 8079:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8080:                                    ERROR
 8081:                            end
 8082:                    end},
 8083:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
 8084:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
 8085:                            socket:listen(LSock)
 8086:                    end},
 8087:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 8088:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 8089:                          tester   := Tester,
 8090:                          local_sa := LSA}) ->
 8091:                            %% Actually we only need to send the path,
 8092:                            %% but to keep it simple, we send the "same"
 8093:                            %% as for non-local.
 8094:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, LSA),
 8095:                            ok;
 8096:                       (#{tester := Tester, local_sa := LSA, lport := Port}) ->
 8097:                            ServerSA = LSA#{port => Port},
 8098:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, ServerSA),
 8099:                            ok
 8100:                    end},
 8101: 
 8102:          %% The actual test
 8103:          #{desc => "await continue (accept all three connections)",
 8104:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 8105:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
 8106:                    end},
 8107:          #{desc => "accept 1",
 8108:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 8109:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 8110:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8111:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: try start handler"),
 8112:                                    Handler = sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(1, Recv, Sock),
 8113:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("handler started"),
 8114:                                    {ok, State#{csock1   => Sock,
 8115:                                                handler1 => Handler}};
 8116:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8117:                                    ERROR
 8118:                            end
 8119:                    end},
 8120:          #{desc => "await handler 1 ready (init)",
 8121:            cmd  => fun(#{tester   := Tester, 
 8122:                          handler1 := Handler1} = _State) ->
 8123:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler1, handler1, init, 
 8124:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8125:                    end},
 8126:          #{desc => "accept 2",
 8127:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 8128:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 8129:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8130:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: try start handler"),
 8131:                                    Handler = sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(2, Recv, Sock),
 8132:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("handler started"),
 8133:                                    {ok, State#{csock2   => Sock,
 8134:                                                handler2 => Handler}};
 8135:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8136:                                    ERROR
 8137:                            end
 8138:                    end},
 8139:          #{desc => "await handler 2 ready (init)",
 8140:            cmd  => fun(#{tester   := Tester, 
 8141:                          handler1 := Handler1, 
 8142:                          handler2 := Handler2} = _State) ->
 8143:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler2, handler2, init, 
 8144:                                             [{tester,   Tester},
 8145:                                              {handler1, Handler1}])
 8146:                    end},
 8147:          #{desc => "accept 3",
 8148:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 8149:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 8150:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8151:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: try start handler"),
 8152:                                    Handler = sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(3, Recv, Sock),
 8153:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("handler started"),
 8154:                                    {ok, State#{csock3   => Sock,
 8155:                                                handler3 => Handler}};
 8156:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8157:                                    ERROR
 8158:                            end
 8159:                    end},
 8160:          #{desc => "await handler 3 ready (init)",
 8161:            cmd  => fun(#{tester   := Tester, 
 8162:                          handler1 := Handler1, 
 8163:                          handler2 := Handler2, 
 8164:                          handler3 := Handler3} = _State) ->
 8165:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler3, handler3, init, 
 8166:                                             [{tester,   Tester},
 8167:                                              {handler1, Handler1},
 8168:                                              {handler2, Handler2}])
 8169:                    end},
 8170:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept all three connections)",
 8171:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8172:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
 8173:                            ok
 8174:                    end},
 8175: 
 8176: 
 8177:          #{desc => "await continue (recv)",
 8178:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 8179:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv)
 8180:                    end},
 8181:          #{desc => "order handler 1 to receive",
 8182:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8183:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 8184:                            ok
 8185:                    end},
 8186:          #{desc => "order handler 2 to receive",
 8187:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8188:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 8189:                            ok
 8190:                    end},
 8191:          #{desc => "order handler 3 to receive",
 8192:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8193:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 8194:                            ok
 8195:                    end},
 8196:          #{desc => "await ready from handler 1 (recv)",
 8197:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 8198:                          handler1 := Pid1,
 8199:                          handler2 := Pid2,
 8200:                          handler3 := Pid3} = _State) ->
 8201:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid1, handler1, recv, 
 8202:                                                  [{tester, Tester},
 8203:                                                   {handler2, Pid2},
 8204:                                                   {handler3, Pid3}]) of
 8205:                                {ok, Result} ->
 8206:                                    Result;
 8207:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 8208:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected failure: "
 8209:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 8210:                                    ERROR
 8211:                            end
 8212:                    end},
 8213:          #{desc => "await ready from handler 2 (recv)",
 8214:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 8215:                          handler1 := Pid1,
 8216:                          handler2 := Pid2,
 8217:                          handler3 := Pid3} = _State) ->
 8218:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid2, handler2, recv, 
 8219:                                                  [{tester, Tester},
 8220:                                                   {handler1, Pid1},
 8221:                                                   {handler3, Pid3}]) of
 8222:                                {ok, Result} ->
 8223:                                    Result;
 8224:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8225:                                    ERROR
 8226:                            end
 8227:                    end},
 8228:          #{desc => "await ready from handler 3 (recv)",
 8229:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 8230:                          handler1 := Pid1,
 8231:                          handler2 := Pid2,
 8232:                          handler3 := Pid3} = _State) ->
 8233:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid3, handler3, recv, 
 8234:                                                  [{tester, Tester},
 8235:                                                   {handler1, Pid1},
 8236:                                                   {handler2, Pid2}]) of
 8237:                                {ok, Result} ->
 8238:                                    Result;
 8239:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8240:                                    ERROR
 8241:                            end
 8242:                    end},
 8243:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv closed from all handlers)",
 8244:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8245:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_closed),
 8246:                            ok
 8247:                    end},
 8248: 
 8249:          %% Termination
 8250:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 8251:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 8252:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 8253:                                ok ->
 8254:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 8255:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8256:                                    ERROR
 8257:                            end
 8258:                    end},
 8259:          #{desc => "order handler 1 to terminate",
 8260:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8261:                            %% Pid ! {terminate, self(), ok},
 8262:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8263:                            ok
 8264:                    end},
 8265:          #{desc => "await handler 1 termination",
 8266:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = State) ->
 8267:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid),
 8268:                            State1 = maps:remove(csock1,   State),
 8269:                            State2 = maps:remove(handler1, State1),
 8270:                            {ok, State2}
 8271:                    end},
 8272:          #{desc => "order handler 2 to terminate",
 8273:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8274:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8275:                            ok
 8276:                    end},
 8277:          #{desc => "await handler 2 termination",
 8278:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = State) ->
 8279:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid),
 8280:                            State1 = maps:remove(csock2,   State),
 8281:                            State2 = maps:remove(handler2, State1),
 8282:                            {ok, State2}
 8283:                    end},
 8284:          #{desc => "order handler 3 to terminate",
 8285:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8286:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8287:                            ok
 8288:                    end},
 8289:          #{desc => "await handler 3 termination",
 8290:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = State) ->
 8291:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid),
 8292:                            State1 = maps:remove(csock3,   State),
 8293:                            State2 = maps:remove(handler3, State1),
 8294:                            {ok, State2}
 8295:                    end},
 8296:          #{desc => "close listen socket",
 8297:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 8298:                          lsock  := LSock,
 8299:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 8300:                            case socket:close(LSock) of
 8301:                                ok ->
 8302:                                    State1 =
 8303:                                        unlink_path(Path,
 8304:                                                    fun() ->
 8305:                                                            maps:remove(lsa, State)
 8306:                                                    end,
 8307:                                                    fun() ->
 8308:                                                            State
 8309:                                                    end),
 8310:                                    {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State1)};
 8311:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8312:                                    unlink_path(Path),
 8313:                                    ERROR
 8314:                            end;
 8315:                       (#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
 8316:                            case socket:close(LSock) of
 8317:                                ok ->
 8318:                                    {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State)};
 8319:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8320:                                    ERROR
 8321:                            end
 8322:                    end},
 8323: 
 8324:          %% *** We are done ***
 8325:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 8326:         ],
 8327: 
 8328:     ClientSeq =
 8329:         [
 8330:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 8331:          #{desc => "await start",
 8332:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 8333:                            {Tester, {NodeID, ServerSA}} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 8334:                            {ok, State#{tester    => Tester, 
 8335:                                        node_id   => NodeID, 
 8336:                                        server_sa => ServerSA}}
 8337:                    end},
 8338:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 8339:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 8340:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 8341:                            ok
 8342:                    end},
 8343: 
 8344:          %% *** Init part ***
 8345:          #{desc => "create node",
 8346:            cmd  => fun(#{node_id := NodeID} = State) ->
 8347:                            {Peer, Node} =
 8348:                                start_node(?CT_PEER_NAME(?F("client_~w",
 8349:                                                            [NodeID]))),
 8350:                            {ok, State#{node => Node, peer => Peer}}
 8351:                    end},
 8352:          #{desc => "monitor client node 1",
 8353:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = _State) ->
 8354:                            true = erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
 8355:                            ok
 8356:                    end},
 8357:          #{desc => "start remote client on client node",
 8358:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = State) ->
 8359:                            Pid = sc_rc_tcp_client_start(Node),
 8360:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("client ~p started", [Pid]),
 8361:                            {ok, State#{rclient => Pid}}
 8362:                    end},
 8363:          #{desc => "monitor remote client",
 8364:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Pid}) ->
 8365:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 8366:                            ok
 8367:                    end},
 8368:          #{desc => "order remote client to start",
 8369:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient   := Client,
 8370:                          server_sa := ServerSA,
 8371:                          protocol  := Proto}) ->
 8372:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Client, {ServerSA, Proto}),
 8373:                            ok
 8374:                    end},
 8375:          #{desc => "await remote client ready",
 8376:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8377:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8378:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, init, 
 8379:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8380:                    end},
 8381:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 8382:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8383:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 8384:                            ok
 8385:                    end},
 8386: 
 8387:          %% The actual test
 8388:          #{desc => "await continue (connect)",
 8389:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8390:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8391:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect, 
 8392:                                                [{rclient, Client}]),
 8393:                            ok
 8394:                    end},
 8395:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (connect)",
 8396:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client}) ->
 8397:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, connect),
 8398:                            ok
 8399:                    end},
 8400:          #{desc => "await client process ready (connect)",
 8401:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8402:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8403:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, connect, 
 8404:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8405:                    end},

 8407:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8408:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, connect),
 8409:                            ok
 8410:                    end},

 8412:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8413:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8414:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close, 
 8415:                                                [{rclient, Client}]),
 8416:                            ok
 8417:                    end},

 8420:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, close),
 8421:                            ok
 8422:                    end},
 8423:          #{desc => "await remote client ready (closed)",

 8427:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8428:                    end},

 8431:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
 8432:                            ok
 8433:                    end},
 8434: 
 8435:          %% Termination
 8436:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 8437:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester, 
 8438:                          rclient := Client} = State) ->
 8439:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester,
 8440:                                                      [{rclient, Client}]) of
 8441:                                ok ->
 8442:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 8443:                                {error,
 8444:                                 {unexpected_exit, rclient, noconnection}} ->
 8445:                                    %% Global might have disconnected => SKIP
 8446:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("lost connection "
 8447:                                                "to remote client node => SKIP"),
 8448:                                    {skip, {rclient, noconnection}};
 8449:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8450:                                    ERROR
 8451:                            end
 8452:                    end},
 8453:          #{desc => "kill remote client",
 8454:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := RClient}) ->
 8455:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("try kill remote client ~p", [RClient]),
 8456:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(RClient),
 8457:                            ok
 8458:                    end},
 8459:          #{desc => "await remote client termination",
 8460:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := RClient} = State) ->
 8461:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(RClient),
 8462:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("remote client ~p terminated",
 8463:                                        [RClient]),
 8464:                            State1 = maps:remove(rclient, State),
 8465:                            {ok, State1}
 8466:                    end},
 8467:          #{desc => "stop client node",
 8468:            cmd  => fun(#{peer := Peer} = State) ->
 8469:                            {ok,
 8470:                             try peer:stop(Peer) of
 8471:                                 ok ->
 8472:                                     State#{node_stop => ok};
 8473:                                 {error, Reason} ->
 8474:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 8475:                                                 "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 8476:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 8477:                             catch
 8478:                                 C:E:S ->
 8479:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 8480:                                                 "~n   Class: ~p"
 8481:                                                 "~n   Error: ~p"
 8482:                                                 "~n   Stack: ~p",[C, E, S]),
 8483:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 8484:                             end}
 8485:                    end},
 8486:          #{desc => "await client node termination",
 8487:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node, node_stop := ok} = State) ->
 8488:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Success node stop - await nodedown: "
 8489:                                        "~n      ~p", [Node]),
 8490:                            receive
 8491:                                {nodedown, Node} ->
 8492:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("nodedown received - cleanup"),
 8493:                                    State1 = maps:remove(peer, State),
 8494:                                    State2 = maps:remove(node, State1),
 8495:                                    {ok, State2}
 8496:                            end;
 8497:                       (#{node_stop := error} = State) ->
 8498:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Failed node stop - cleanup"),
 8499:                            State1 = maps:remove(peer, State),
 8500:                            State2 = maps:remove(node, State1),
 8501:                            {ok, State2}
 8502:                    end},
 8503: 
 8504:          %% *** We are done ***
 8505:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 8506:         ],

 8757:                            ok
 8758:                    end},

 8760:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = State) ->

 8762:                                ok ->
 8763:                                    State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
 8764:                                    {ok, State1};
 8765:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8766:                                    ERROR
 8767:                            end
 8768:                    end},

 8771:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 8772:         ],
 8773: 
 8774:     i("start server evaluator"),
 8775:     ServerInitState = InitState,
 8776:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
 8777: 
 8778:     i("start client evaluator(s)"),
 8779:     ClientInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
 8780:     Client1 = ?SEV_START("client-1", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 8781:     Client2 = ?SEV_START("client-2", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 8782:     Client3 = ?SEV_START("client-3", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 8783: 
 8784:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 8785:     TesterInitState = #{server  => Server#ev.pid,
 8786:                         client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 8787:                         client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 8788:                         client3 => Client3#ev.pid},
 8789:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 8790: 
 8791:     i("await evaluator"),
 8792:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server,
 8793:                             Client1, Client2, Client3,
 8794:                             Tester]).

 8796: 
 8797: sc_rc_tcp_client_start(Node) ->
 8798:     Self = self(),
 8799:     Fun  = fun() -> sc_rc_tcp_client(Self) end,
 8800:     erlang:spawn(Node, Fun).
 8801: 
 8802: 
 8803: sc_rc_tcp_client(Parent) ->
 8804:     sc_rc_tcp_client_init(Parent),
 8805:     {ServerSA, Proto} = sc_rc_tcp_client_await_start(Parent),
 8806:     Domain   = maps:get(family, ServerSA),
 8807:     Sock     = sc_rc_tcp_client_create(Domain, Proto),
 8808:     Path     = sc_rc_tcp_client_bind(Sock, Domain),
 8809:     sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, init),
 8810:     sc_rc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, connect),
 8811:     sc_rc_tcp_client_connect(Sock, ServerSA),
 8812:     sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, connect),
 8813:     sc_rc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, close),
 8814:     sc_rc_tcp_client_close(Sock, Path),
 8815:     sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, close),
 8816:     Reason = sc_rc_tcp_client_await_terminate(Parent),
 8817:     ?SEV_IPRINT("terminate"),
 8818:     exit(Reason).
 8819: 
 8820: sc_rc_tcp_client_init(Parent) ->
 8821:     put(sname, "rclient"),
 8822:     ?SEV_IPRINT("init"),
 8823:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
 8824:     ok.
 8825: 
 8826: sc_rc_tcp_client_await_start(Parent) ->
 8827:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_await_start -> entry"),
 8828:     ?SEV_AWAIT_START(Parent).
 8829: 
 8830: sc_rc_tcp_client_create(Domain, Proto) ->
 8831:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_create -> entry"),
 8832:     case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 8833:         {ok, Sock} ->
 8834:             case socket:getopt(Sock, otp, fd) of
 8835:                 {ok, FD} ->
 8836:                     put(sname, ?F("rclient-~w", [FD])); % Update SName
 8837:                 _ ->
 8838:                     ok
 8839:             end,
 8840:             Sock;
 8841:         {error, Reason} ->
 8842:             exit({open_failed, Reason})
 8843:     end.
 8844: 
 8845: sc_rc_tcp_client_bind(Sock, Domain) ->
 8846:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_bind -> entry"),
 8847:     LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 8848:     case socket:bind(Sock, LSA) of
 8849:         ok ->
 8850:             case socket:sockname(Sock) of
 8851:                 {ok, #{family := local, path := Path}} ->
 8852:                     Path;
 8853:                 {ok, _} ->
 8854:                     undefined;
 8855:                 {error, Reason1} ->
 8856:                     exit({sockname, Reason1})
 8857:             end;
 8858:         {error, Reason} ->
 8859:             exit({bind, Reason})
 8860:     end.
 8861: 
 8862: sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan) ->
 8863:     ?SEV_IPRINT("ready ~w", [Slogan]),
 8864:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan).
 8865: 
 8866: sc_rc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, Slogan) ->
 8867:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await ~w continue", [Slogan]),
 8868:     ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Parent, parent, Slogan).
 8869: 
 8870: sc_rc_tcp_client_connect(Sock, ServerSA) ->
 8871:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_connect -> entry"),
 8872:     case socket:connect(Sock, ServerSA) of
 8873:         ok ->
 8874:             ok;
 8875:         {error, Reason} ->
 8876:             exit({connect, Reason})
 8877:     end.
 8878: 
 8879: sc_rc_tcp_client_close(Sock, Path) ->
 8880:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_close -> entry"),
 8881:     case socket:close(Sock) of
 8882:         ok ->
 8883:             unlink_path(Path),
 8884:             ok;
 8885:         {error, Reason} ->
 8886:             ?SEV_EPRINT("failed closing: "
 8887:                         "~n   Reason: ~p", [Reason]),
 8888:             unlink_path(Path),
 8889:             {error, {close, Reason}}
 8890:     end.
 8891: 
 8892: sc_rc_tcp_client_await_terminate(Parent) ->
 8893:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_await_terminate -> entry"),
 8894:     case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Parent, parent) of
 8895:         ok ->
 8896:             ok;
 8897:         {error, Reason} ->
 8898:             Reason
 8899:     end.
 8900: 
 8901: 
 8902: %% The handlers run on the same node as the server (the local node).
 8903: 
 8904: sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(ID, Recv, Sock) ->
 8905:     Self     = self(),
 8906:     Fun      = fun() -> sc_rc_tcp_handler(ID, Self, Recv, Sock) end,
 8907:     {Pid, _} = erlang:spawn_monitor(Fun),
 8908:     Pid.
 8909: 
 8910: sc_rc_tcp_handler(ID, Parent, Recv, Sock) ->
 8911:     sc_rc_tcp_handler_init(ID, socket:getopt(Sock, otp, fd), Parent),
 8912:     sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, recv),
 8913:     RecvRes = sc_rc_tcp_handler_recv(Recv, Sock),
 8914:     sc_rc_tcp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, recv, RecvRes),
 8915:     Reason = sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, terminate),
 8916:     exit(Reason).
 8917: 
 8918: sc_rc_tcp_handler_init(ID, {ok, FD}, Parent) ->
 8919:     put(sname, ?F("handler-~w:~w", [ID, FD])),
 8920:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
 8921:     ?SEV_IPRINT("started"),
 8922:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, init),
 8923:     ok.
 8924: 
 8925: sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, terminate) ->
 8926:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await terminate"),
 8927:     ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Parent, tester);
 8928: sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, Slogan) ->
 8929:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await ~w", [Slogan]),
 8930:     ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Parent, parent, Slogan).
 8931: 
 8932: sc_rc_tcp_handler_recv(Recv, Sock) ->
 8933:     ?SEV_IPRINT("recv"),
 8934:     try Recv(Sock) of
 8935:         {error, closed} ->
 8936:             ok;
 8937:         {ok, Data} ->
 8938:             ?SEV_IPRINT("unexpected success: "
 8939:                         "~n   (Unexp) Data: ~p"
 8940:                         "~n   Socket Info:  ~p", [Data, socket:info(Sock)]),
 8941:             {error, unexpected_success};
 8942:         {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 8943:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive error: "
 8944:                         "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 8945:             ERROR
 8946:     catch
 8947:         error:notsup = Error:Stack ->
 8948:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive ~w error: skip"
 8949:                         "~n   Stack: ~p", [Error, Stack]),
 8950:             exit({skip, Error});
 8951:         C:E:S ->
 8952:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive failure: "
 8953:                         "~n   Class: ~p"
 8954:                         "~n   Error: ~p"
 8955:                         "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 8956:             {error, {recv, C, E, S}}
 8957:     end.
 8958: 
 8959: sc_rc_tcp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan, Result) ->
 8960:     ?SEV_IPRINT("announce ready"),
 8961:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan, Result),
 8962:     ok.
 8963:

 8965: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8966: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 8967: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
 8968: %% Socket is IPv4.
 8969: 
 8970: sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 8971:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 8972:     tc_try(sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcp4,
 8973:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 8974:            fun() ->
 8975:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,
 8976:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 8977:                                  protocol => tcp,
 8978:                                  recv     => Recv},
 8979:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 8980:            end).
 8981:

 8993:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,

 9003: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
 9004: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.

 9006: sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 9007:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 9008:     tc_try(sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcpL,
 9009:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
 9010:            fun() ->
 9011:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,
 9012:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 9013:                                  protocol => default,
 9014:                                  recv     => Recv},
 9015:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 9016:            end).
